1.1: Exo 1:1 These are the names of the sons of Israel who came to Egypt with Jacob, each with his household:
1.2: Exo 1:2 Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
1.4: Exo 1:4 Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
1.5: Exo 1:5 All the descendants of Jacob were seventy persons; Joseph was already in Egypt.
1.6: Exo 1:6 Then Joseph died, and all his brothers and all that generation.
1.7:
Exo 1:7 But the people of Israel were fruitful and increased greatly; they multiplied and grew exceedingly strong,
so that the land was filled with them.
1.8: Exo 1:8 Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who did not know Joseph.
1.9: Exo 1:9 And he said to his people, "Behold, the people of Israel are too many and too mighty for us.
1.10:
Exo 1:10 Come, let us deal shrewdly with them, lest they multiply, and, if war breaks out, they join our enemies
and fight against us and escape from the land."
1.11:
Exo 1:11 Therefore they set taskmasters over them to afflict them with heavy burdens. They built for Pharaoh
store cities, Pithom and Raamses.
1.12:
Exo 1:12 But the more they were oppressed, the more they multiplied and the more they spread abroad. And
the Egyptians were in dread of the people of Israel.
1.13: Exo 1:13 So they ruthlessly made the people of Israel work as slaves
1.14:
Exo 1:14 and made their lives bitter with hard service, in mortar and brick, and in all kinds of work in the field. In
all their work they ruthlessly made them work as slaves.
1.15:
Exo 1:15 Then the king of Egypt said to the Hebrew midwives, one of whom was named Shiphrah and the other
Puah,
1.16:
Exo 1:16 "When you serve as midwife to the Hebrew women and see them on the birthstool, if it is a son, you
shall kill him, but if it is a daughter, she shall live."
1.17:
Exo 1:17 But the midwives feared God and did not do as the king of Egypt commanded them, but let the male
children live.
1.18:
Exo 1:18 So the king of Egypt called the midwives and said to them, "Why have you done this, and let the male
children live?"
1.19:
Exo 1:19 The midwives said to Pharaoh, "Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women, for
they are vigorous and give birth before the midwife comes to them."
1.20: Exo 1:20 So God dealt well with the midwives. And the people multiplied and grew very strong.
1.21: Exo 1:21 And because the midwives feared God, he gave them families.
1.22:
Exo 1:22 Then Pharaoh commanded all his people, "Every son that is born to the Hebrews you shall cast into
the Nile, but you shall let every daughter live."

2.1: Exo 2:1 Now a man from the house of Levi went and took as his wife a Levite woman.
2.2:
Exo 2:2 The woman conceived and bore a son, and when she saw that he was a fine child, she hid him three
months.
2.3:
Exo 2:3 When she could hide him no longer, she took for him a basket made of bulrushes and daubed it with
bitumen and pitch. She put the child in it and placed it among the reeds by the river bank.
2.4: Exo 2:4 And his sister stood at a distance to know what would be done to him.
2.5:
Exo 2:5 Now the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe at the river, while her young women walked beside
the river. She saw the basket among the reeds and sent her servant woman, and she took it.
2.6:
Exo 2:6 When she opened it, she saw the child, and behold, the baby was crying. She took pity on him and
said, "This is one of the Hebrews' children."
2.7:
Exo 2:7 Then his sister said to Pharaoh's daughter, "Shall I go and call you a nurse from the Hebrew women to
nurse the child for you?"
2.8: Exo 2:8 And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, "Go." So the girl went and called the child's mother.
2.9:
Exo 2:9 And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, "Take this child away and nurse him for me, and I will give you
your wages." So the woman took the child and nursed him.
2.10:
Exo 2:10 When the child grew up, she brought him to Pharaoh's daughter, and he became her son. She named
him Moses, "Because," she said, "I drew him out of the water."
2.11:
Exo 2:11 One day, when Moses had grown up, he went out to his people and looked on their burdens, and he
saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, one of his people.
2.12: Exo 2:12 He looked this way and that, and seeing no one, he struck down the Egyptian and hid him in the sand.
2.13:
Exo 2:13 When he went out the next day, behold, two Hebrews were struggling together. And he said to the
man in the wrong, "Why do you strike your companion?"
2.14:
Exo 2:14 He answered, "Who made you a prince and a judge over us? Do you mean to kill me as you killed the
Egyptian?" Then Moses was afraid, and thought, "Surely the thing is known."
2.15:
Exo 2:15 When Pharaoh heard of it, he sought to kill Moses. But Moses fled from Pharaoh and stayed in the
land of Midian. And he sat down by a well.
2.16:
Exo 2:16 Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters, and they came and drew water and filled the troughs to
water their father's flock.
2.17:
Exo 2:17 The shepherds came and drove them away, but Moses stood up and saved them, and watered their
flock.
2.18:
Exo 2:18 When they came home to their father Reuel, he said, "How is it that you have come home so soon
today?"
2.19:
Exo 2:19 They said, "An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds and even drew water for us and
watered the flock."
2.20:
Exo 2:20 He said to his daughters, "Then where is he? Why have you left the man? Call him, that he may eat
bread."
2.21: Exo 2:21 And Moses was content to dwell with the man, and he gave Moses his daughter Zipporah.
2.22:
Exo 2:22 She gave birth to a son, and he called his name Gershom, for he said, "I have been a sojourner in a
foreign land."
2.23:
Exo 2:23 During those many days the king of Egypt died, and the people of Israel groaned because of their
slavery and cried out for help. Their cry for rescue from slavery came up to God.
2.24:
Exo 2:24 And God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with
Jacob.
2.25: Exo 2:25 God saw the people of Israel- and God knew.

3.1:
Exo 3:1 Now Moses was keeping the flock of his father-in-law, Jethro, the priest of Midian, and he led his flock
to the west side of the wilderness and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.
3.2:
Exo 3:2 And the angel of the LORD appeared to him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush. He looked, and
behold, the bush was burning, yet it was not consumed.
3.3: Exo 3:3 And Moses said, "I will turn aside to see this great sight, why the bush is not burned."
3.4:
Exo 3:4 When the LORD saw that he turned aside to see, God called to him out of the bush, "Moses, Moses!"
And he said, "Here I am."
3.5:
Exo 3:5 Then he said, "Do not come near; take your sandals off your feet, for the place on which you are
standing is holy ground."
3.6:
Exo 3:6 And he said, "I am the God of your father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of
Jacob." And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look at God.
3.7:
Exo 3:7 Then the LORD said, "I have surely seen the affliction of my people who are in Egypt and have heard
their cry because of their taskmasters. I know their sufferings,
3.8:
Exo 3:8 and I have come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians and to bring them up out of that
land to a good and broad land, a land flowing with milk and honey, to the place of the Canaanites, the Hittites,
the Amorites, the Periz-zites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
3.9:
Exo 3:9 And now, behold, the cry of the people of Israel has come to me, and I have also seen the oppression
with which the Egyptians oppress them.
3.10: Exo 3:10 Come, I will send you to Pharaoh that you may bring my people, the children of Israel, out of Egypt."
3.11:
Exo 3:11 But Moses said to God, "Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh and bring the children of Israel out of
Egypt?"
3.12:
Exo 3:12 He said, "But I will be with you, and this shall be the sign for you, that I have sent you: when you have
brought the people out of Egypt, you shall serve God on this mountain."
3.13:
Exo 3:13 Then Moses said to God, "If I come to the people of Israel and say to them, 'The God of your fathers
has sent me to you,' and they ask me, 'What is his name?' what shall I say to them?"
3.14:
Exo 3:14 God said to Moses, "I AM WHO I AM." And he said, "Say this to the people of Israel, 'I AM has sent
me to you.'"
3.15:
Exo 3:15 God also said to Moses, "Say this to the people of Israel, 'The LORD, the God of your fathers, the God
of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has sent me to you.' This is my name forever, and thus I
am to be remembered throughout all generations.
3.16:
Exo 3:16 Go and gather the elders of Israel together and say to them, 'The LORD, the God of your fathers, the
God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, has appeared to me, saying, "I have observed you and what has been
done to you in Egypt,
3.17:
Exo 3:17 and I promise that I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt to the land of the Canaanites, the
Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, a land flowing with milk and honey."'
3.18:
Exo 3:18 And they will listen to your voice, and you and the elders of Israel shall go to the king of Egypt and say
to him, 'The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, has met with us; and now, please let us go a three days' journey
into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.'
3.19: Exo 3:19 But I know that the king of Egypt will not let you go unless compelled by a mighty hand.
3.20:
Exo 3:20 So I will stretch out my hand and strike Egypt with all the wonders that I will do in it; after that he will let
you go.
3.21: Exo 3:21 And I will give this people favor in the sight of the Egyptians; and when you go, you shall not go empty,
3.22:
Exo 3:22 but each woman shall ask of her neighbor, and any woman who lives in her house, for silver and gold
jewelry, and for clothing. You shall put them on your sons and on your daughters. So you shall plunder the
Egyptians."

4.1:
Exo 4:1 Then Moses answered, "But behold, they will not believe me or listen to my voice, for they will say, 'The
LORD did not appear to you.'"
4.2: Exo 4:2 The LORD said to him, "What is that in your hand?" He said, "A staff."
4.3:
Exo 4:3 And he said, "Throw it on the ground." So he threw it on the ground, and it became a serpent, and
Moses ran from it.
4.4: Exo 4:4 But the LORD said to Moses, "Put out your hand and catch it by the tail"- so he put out his hand andcaught it, and it became a staff in his hand
4.5:
Exo 4:5 "that they may believe that the LORD, the God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac,
and the God of Jacob, has appeared to you."
4.6:
Exo 4:6 Again, the LORD said to him, "Put your hand inside your cloak." And he put his hand inside his cloak,
and when he took it out, behold, his hand was leprous like snow.
4.7:
Exo 4:7 Then God said, "Put your hand back inside your cloak." So he put his hand back inside his cloak, and
when he took it out, behold, it was restored like the rest of his flesh.
4.8: Exo 4:8 "If they will not believe you," God said, "or listen to the first sign, they may believe the latter sign.
4.9:
Exo 4:9 If they will not believe even these two signs or listen to your voice, you shall take some water from the
Nile and pour it on the dry ground, and the water that you shall take from the Nile will become blood on the dry
ground."
4.10:
Exo 4:10 But Moses said to the LORD, "Oh, my Lord, I am not eloquent, either in the past or since you have
spoken to your servant, but I am slow of speech and of tongue."
4.11:
Exo 4:11 Then the LORD said to him, "Who has made man's mouth? Who makes him mute, or deaf, or seeing,
or blind? Is it not I, the LORD?
4.12: Exo 4:12 Now therefore go, and I will be with your mouth and teach you what you shall speak."
4.13: Exo 4:13 But he said, "Oh, my Lord, please send someone else."
4.14:
Exo 4:14 Then the anger of the LORD was kindled against Moses and he said, "Is there not Aaron, your
brother, the Levite? I know that he can speak well. Behold, he is coming out to meet you, and when he sees you,
he will be glad in his heart.
4.15:
Exo 4:15 You shall speak to him and put the words in his mouth, and I will be with your mouth and with his
mouth and will teach you both what to do.
4.16: Exo 4:16 He shall speak for you to the people, and he shall be your mouth, and you shall be as God to him.
4.17: Exo 4:17 And take in your hand this staff, with which you shall do the signs."
4.18:
Exo 4:18 Moses went back to Jethro his father-in-law and said to him, "Please let me go back to my brothers in
Egypt to see whether they are still alive." And Jethro said to Moses, "Go in peace."
4.19:
Exo 4:19 And the LORD said to Moses in Midian, "Go back to Egypt, for all the men who were seeking your life
are dead."
4.20:
Exo 4:20 So Moses took his wife and his sons and had them ride on a donkey, and went back to the land of
Egypt. And Moses took the staff of God in his hand.
4.21:
Exo 4:21 And the LORD said to Moses, "When you go back to Egypt, see that you do before Pharaoh all the
miracles that I have put in your power. But I will harden his heart, so that he will not let the people go.
4.22: Exo 4:22 Then you shall say to Pharaoh, 'Thus says the LORD, Israel is my firstborn son,
4.23:
Exo 4:23 and I say to you, "Let my son go that he may serve me." If you refuse to let him go, behold, I will kill
your firstborn son.'"
4.24: Exo 4:24 At a lodging place on the way the LORD met him and sought to put him to death.
4.25:
Exo 4:25 Then Zipporah took a flint and cut off her son's foreskin and touched Moses' feet with it and said,
"Surely you are a bridegroom of blood to me!"
4.26: Exo 4:26 So he let him alone. It was then that she said, "A bridegroom of blood," because of the circumcision.
4.27:
Exo 4:27 The LORD said to Aaron, "Go into the wilderness to meet Moses." So he went and met him at the
mountain of God and kissed him.
4.28:
Exo 4:28 And Moses told Aaron all the words of the LORD with which he had sent him to speak, and all the
signs that he had commanded him to do.
4.29: Exo 4:29 Then Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the people of Israel.
4.30:
Exo 4:30 Aaron spoke all the words that the LORD had spoken to Moses and did the signs in the sight of the
people.
4.31:
Exo 4:31 And the people believed; and when they heard that the LORD had visited the people of Israel and that
he had seen their affliction, they bowed their heads and worshiped.

5.1:
Exo 5:1 Afterward Moses and Aaron went and said to Pharaoh, "Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, 'Let my
people go, that they may hold a feast to me in the wilderness.'"
5.2:
Exo 5:2 But Pharaoh said, "Who is the LORD, that I should obey his voice and let Israel go? I do not know the
LORD, and moreover, I will not let Israel go."
5.3:
Exo 5:3 Then they said, "The God of the Hebrews has met with us. Please let us go a three days' journey into
the wilderness that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God, lest he fall upon us with pestilence or with the
sword."
5.4:
Exo 5:4 But the king of Egypt said to them, "Moses and Aaron, why do you take the people away from their
work? Get back to your burdens."
5.5:
Exo 5:5 And Pharaoh said, "Behold, the people of the land are now many, and you make them rest from their
burdens!"
5.6: Exo 5:6 The same day Pharaoh commanded the taskmasters of the people and their foremen,
5.7:
Exo 5:7 "You shall no longer give the people straw to make bricks, as in the past; let them go and gather straw
for themselves.
5.8:
Exo 5:8 But the number of bricks that they made in the past you shall impose on them, you shall by no means
reduce it, for they are idle. Therefore they cry, 'Let us go and offer sacrifice to our God.'
5.9: Exo 5:9 Let heavier work be laid on the men that they may labor at it and pay no regard to lying words."
5.10:
Exo 5:10 So the taskmasters and the foremen of the people went out and said to the people, "Thus says
Pharaoh, 'I will not give you straw.
5.11:
Exo 5:11 Go and get your straw yourselves wherever you can find it, but your work will not be reduced in the
least.'"
5.12: Exo 5:12 So the people were scattered throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble for straw.
5.13:
Exo 5:13 The taskmasters were urgent, saying, "Complete your work, your daily task each day, as when there
was straw."
5.14:
Exo 5:14 And the foremen of the people of Israel, whom Pharaoh's taskmasters had set over them, were beaten
and were asked, "Why have you not done all your task of making bricks today and yesterday, as in the past?"
5.15:
Exo 5:15 Then the foremen of the people of Israel came and cried to Pharaoh, "Why do you treat your servants
like this?
5.16:
Exo 5:16 No straw is given to your servants, yet they say to us, 'Make bricks!' And behold, your servants are
beaten; but the fault is in your own people."
5.17: Exo 5:17 But he said, "You are idle, you are idle; that is why you say, 'Let us go and sacrifice to the LORD.'
5.18: Exo 5:18 Go now and work. No straw will be given you, but you must still deliver the same number of bricks."
5.19:
Exo 5:19 The foremen of the people of Israel saw that they were in trouble when they said, "You shall by no
means reduce your number of bricks, your daily task each day."
5.20: Exo 5:20 They met Moses and Aaron, who were waiting for them, as they came out from Pharaoh;
5.21:
Exo 5:21 and they said to them, "The LORD look on you and judge, because you have made us stink in the
sight of Pharaoh and his servants, and have put a sword in their hand to kill us."
5.22:
Exo 5:22 Then Moses turned to the LORD and said, "O LORD, why have you done evil to this people? Why did
you ever send me?
5.23:
Exo 5:23 For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in your name, he has done evil to this people, and you have not
delivered your people at all."

6.1:
Exo 6:1 But the LORD said to Moses, "Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh; for with a strong hand he
will send them out, and with a strong hand he will drive them out of his land."
6.2: Exo 6:2 God spoke to Moses and said to him, "I am the LORD.
6.3:
Exo 6:3 I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, as God Almighty, but by my name the LORD I did not
make myself known to them.
6.4:
Exo 6:4 I also established my covenant with them to give them the land of Canaan, the land in which they lived
as sojourners.
6.5:
Exo 6:5 Moreover, I have heard the groaning of the people of Israel whom the Egyptians hold as slaves, and I
have remembered my covenant.
6.6:
Exo 6:6 Say therefore to the people of Israel, 'I am the LORD, and I will bring you out from under the burdens of
the Egyptians, and I will deliver you from slavery to them, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and
with great acts of judgment.
6.7:
Exo 6:7 I will take you to be my people, and I will be your God, and you shall know that I am the LORD your
God, who has brought you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
6.8:
Exo 6:8 I will bring you into the land that I swore to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob. I will give it to you
for a possession. I am the LORD.'"
6.9:
Exo 6:9 Moses spoke thus to the people of Israel, but they did not listen to Moses, because of their broken spirit
and harsh slavery.
6.10: Exo 6:10 So the LORD said to Moses,
6.11: Exo 6:11 "Go in, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the people of Israel go out of his land."
6.12:
Exo 6:12 But Moses said to the LORD, "Behold, the people of Israel have not listened to me. How then shall
Pharaoh listen to me, for I am of uncircumcised lips?"
6.13:
Exo 6:13 But the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron and gave them a charge about the people of Israel and
about Pharaoh king of Egypt: to bring the people of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
6.14:
Exo 6:14 These are the heads of their fathers' houses: the sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch,
Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi; these are the clans of Reuben.
6.15:
Exo 6:15 The sons of Simeon: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul, the son of a Canaanite woman;
these are the clans of Simeon.
6.16: Exo 6:16 These are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari,the years of the life of Levi being 137 years.
6.17: Exo 6:17 The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, by their clans.
6.18:
Exo 6:18 The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, the years of the life of Kohath being 133
years.
6.19:
Exo 6:19 The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of the Levites according to their
generations.
6.20:
Exo 6:20 Amram took as his wife Jochebed his father's sister, and she bore him Aaron and Moses, the years of
the life of Amram being 137 years.
6.21: Exo 6:21 The sons of Izhar: Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri.
6.22: Exo 6:22 The sons of Uzziel: Mishael, Elzaphan, and Sithri.
6.23:
Exo 6:23 Aaron took as his wife Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab and the sister of Nahshon, and she bore
him Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
6.24: Exo 6:24 The sons of Korah: Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the clans of the Korahites.
6.25:
Exo 6:25 Eleazar, Aaron's son, took as his wife one of the daughters of Putiel, and she bore him Phinehas.
These are the heads of the fathers' houses of the Levites by their clans.
6.26:
Exo 6:26 These are the Aaron and Moses to whom the LORD said: "Bring out the people of Israel from the land
of Egypt by their hosts."
6.27:
Exo 6:27 It was they who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt about bringing out the people of Israel from Egypt, this
Moses and this Aaron.
6.28: Exo 6:28 On the day when the LORD spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt,
6.29: Exo 6:29 the LORD said to Moses, "I am the LORD; tell Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I say to you."
6.30: Exo 6:30 But Moses said to the LORD, "Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips. How will Pharaoh listen to me?"

7.1:
Exo 7:1 And the LORD said to Moses, "See, I have made you like God to Pharaoh, and your brother Aaron shall
be your prophet.
7.2:
Exo 7:2 You shall speak all that I command you, and your brother Aaron shall tell Pharaoh to let the people of
Israel go out of his land.
7.3: Exo 7:3 But I will harden Pharaoh's heart, and though I multiply my signs and wonders in the land of Egypt,
7.4:
Exo 7:4 Pharaoh will not listen to you. Then I will lay my hand on Egypt and bring my hosts, my people the
children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great acts of judgment.
7.5:
Exo 7:5 The Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I stretch out my hand against Egypt and bring out
the people of Israel from among them."
7.6: Exo 7:6 Moses and Aaron did so; they did just as the LORD commanded them.
7.7: Exo 7:7 Now Moses was eighty years old, and Aaron eighty-three years old, when they spoke to Pharaoh.
7.8: Exo 7:8 Then the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
7.9:
Exo 7:9 "When Pharaoh says to you, 'Prove yourselves by working a miracle,' then you shall say to Aaron,
'Take your staff and cast it down before Pharaoh, that it may become a serpent.'"
7.10:
Exo 7:10 So Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and did just as the LORD commanded. Aaron cast down his
staff before Pharaoh and his servants, and it became a serpent.
7.11:
Exo 7:11 Then Pharaoh summoned the wise men and the sorcerers, and they, the magicians of Egypt, also did
the same by their secret arts.
7.12:
Exo 7:12 For each man cast down his staff, and they became serpents. But Aaron's staff swallowed up their
staffs.
7.13: Exo 7:13 Still Pharaoh's heart was hardened, and he would not listen to them, as the LORD had said.
7.14: Exo 7:14 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Pharaoh's heart is hardened; he refuses to let the people go.
7.15:
Exo 7:15 Go to Pharaoh in the morning, as he is going out to the water. Stand on the bank of the Nile to meet
him, and take in your hand the staff that turned into a serpent.
7.16:
Exo 7:16 And you shall say to him, 'The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, sent me to you, saying, "Let my people
go, that they may serve me in the wilderness. But so far, you have not obeyed."
7.17:
Exo 7:17 Thus says the LORD, "By this you shall know that I am the LORD: behold, with the staff that is in my
hand I will strike the water that is in the Nile, and it shall turn into blood.
7.18:
Exo 7:18 The fish in the Nile shall die, and the Nile will stink, and the Egyptians will grow weary of drinking water
from the Nile."'"
7.19:
Exo 7:19 And the LORD said to Moses, "Say to Aaron, 'Take your staff and stretch out your hand over the
waters of Egypt, over their rivers, their canals, and their ponds, and all their pools of water, so that they may
become blood, and there shall be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, even in vessels of wood and in vessels
of stone.'"
7.20:
Exo 7:20 Moses and Aaron did as the LORD commanded. In the sight of Pharaoh and in the sight of his
servants he lifted up the staff and struck the water in the Nile, and all the water in the Nile turned into blood.
7.21: Exo 7:21 And the fish in the Nile died, and the Nile stank, so that the Egyptians could not drink water from theNile. There was blood throughout all the land of Egypt.
7.22:
Exo 7:22 But the magicians of Egypt did the same by their secret arts. So Pharaoh's heart remained hardened,
and he would not listen to them, as the LORD had said.
7.23: Exo 7:23 Pharaoh turned and went into his house, and he did not take even this to heart.
7.24:
Exo 7:24 And all the Egyptians dug along the Nile for water to drink, for they could not drink the water of the
Nile.
7.25: Exo 7:25 Seven full days passed after the LORD had struck the Nile.

8.1:
Exo 8:1 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Go in to Pharaoh and say to him,'Thus says the LORD, "Let my people
go, that they may serve me.
8.2: Exo 8:2 But if you refuse to let them go, behold, I will plague all your country with frogs.
8.3:
Exo 8:3 The Nile shall swarm with frogs that shall come up into your house and into your bedroom and on your
bed and into the houses of your servants and your people, and into your ovens and your kneading bowls.
8.4: Exo 8:4 The frogs shall come up on you and on your people and on all your servants."'"
8.5:
Exo 8:5 And the LORD said to Moses, "Say to Aaron, 'Stretch out your hand with your staff over the rivers, over
the canals and over the pools, and make frogs come up on the land of Egypt!'"
8.6:
Exo 8:6 So Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt, and the frogs came up and covered the land
of Egypt.
8.7: Exo 8:7 But the magicians did the same by their secret arts and made frogs come up on the land of Egypt.
8.8:
Exo 8:8 Then Pharaoh called Moses and Aaron and said, "Plead with the LORD to take away the frogs from me
and from my people, and I will let the people go to sacrifice to the LORD."
8.9:
Exo 8:9 Moses said to Pharaoh, "Be pleased to command me when I am to plead for you and for your servants
and for your people, that the frogs be cut off from you and your houses and be left only in the Nile."
8.10:
Exo 8:10 And he said, "Tomorrow." Moses said, "Be it as you say, so that you may know that there is no one
like the LORD our God.
8.11:
Exo 8:11 The frogs shall go away from you and your houses and your servants and your people. They shall be
left only in the Nile."
8.12:
Exo 8:12 So Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh, and Moses cried to the LORD about the frogs, as he had
agreed with Pharaoh.
8.13:
Exo 8:13 And the LORD did according to the word of Moses. The frogs died out in the houses, the courtyards,
and the fields.
8.14: Exo 8:14 And they gathered them together in heaps, and the land stank.
8.15:
Exo 8:15 But when Pharaoh saw that there was a respite, he hardened his heart and would not listen to them,
as the LORD had said.
8.16:
Exo 8:16 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Say to Aaron, 'Stretch out your staff and strike the dust of the earth,
so that it may become gnats in all the land of Egypt.'"
8.17:
Exo 8:17 And they did so. Aaron stretched out his hand with his staff and struck the dust of the earth, and there
were gnats on man and beast. All the dust of the earth became gnats in all the land of Egypt.
8.18:
Exo 8:18 The magicians tried by their secret arts to produce gnats, but they could not. So there were gnats on
man and beast.
8.19:
Exo 8:19 Then the magicians said to Pharaoh, "This is the finger of God." But Pharaoh's heart was hardened,
and he would not listen to them, as the LORD had said.
8.20:
Exo 8:20 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Rise up early in the morning and present yourself to Pharaoh, as he
goes out to the water, and say to him, 'Thus says the LORD, "Let my people go, that they may serve me.
8.21:
Exo 8:21 Or else, if you will not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies on you and your servants
and your people, and into your houses. And the houses of the Egyptians shall be filled with swarms of flies, and
also the ground on which they stand.
8.22:
Exo 8:22 But on that day I will set apart the land of Goshen, where my people dwell, so that no swarms of flies
shall be there, that you may know that I am the LORD in the midst of the earth.
8.23: Exo 8:23 Thus I will put a division between my people and your people. Tomorrow this sign shall happen."'"
8.24:
Exo 8:24 And the LORD did so. There came great swarms of flies into the house of Pharaoh and into his
servants' houses. Throughout all the land of Egypt the land was ruined by the swarms of flies.
8.25: Exo 8:25 Then Pharaoh called Moses and Aaron and said, "Go, sacrifice to your God within the land."
8.26:
Exo 8:26 But Moses said, "It would not be right to do so, for the offerings we shall sacrifice to the LORD our God
are an abomination to the Egyptians. If we sacrifice offerings abominable to the Egyptians before their eyes, will
they not stone us?
8.27: Exo 8:27 We must go three days' journey into the wilderness and sacrifice to the LORD our God as he tells us."
8.28:
Exo 8:28 So Pharaoh said, "I will let you go to sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only you must
not go very far away. Plead for me."
8.29:
Exo 8:29 Then Moses said, "Behold, I am going out from you and I will plead with the LORD that the swarms offlies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, tomorrow. Only let not Pharaoh cheat
again by not letting the people go to sacrifice to the LORD."
8.30: Exo 8:30 So Moses went out from Pharaoh and prayed to the LORD.
8.31:
Exo 8:31 And the LORD did as Moses asked, and removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants,
and from his people; not one remained.
8.32: Exo 8:32 But Pharaoh hardened his heart this time also, and did not let the people go.

9.1:
Exo 9:1 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Go in to Pharaoh and say to him, 'Thus says the LORD, the God of the
Hebrews, "Let my people go, that they may serve me.
9.2: Exo 9:2 For if you refuse to let them go and still hold them,
9.3:
Exo 9:3 behold, the hand of the LORD will fall with a very severe plague upon your livestock that are in the field,
the horses, the donkeys, the camels, the herds, and the flocks.
9.4:
Exo 9:4 But the LORD will make a distinction between the livestock of Israel and the livestock of Egypt, so that
nothing of all that belongs to the people of Israel shall die."'"
9.5: Exo 9:5 And the LORD set a time, saying, "Tomorrow the LORD will do this thing in the land."
9.6:
Exo 9:6 And the next day the LORD did this thing. All the livestock of the Egyptians died, but not one of the
livestock of the people of Israel died.
9.7:
Exo 9:7 And Pharaoh sent, and behold, not one of the livestock of Israel was dead. But the heart of Pharaoh
was hardened, and he did not let the people go.
9.8:
Exo 9:8 And the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, "Take handfuls of soot from the kiln, and let Moses throw
them in the air in the sight of Pharaoh.
9.9:
Exo 9:9 It shall become fine dust over all the land of Egypt, and become boils breaking out in sores on man and
beast throughout all the land of Egypt."
9.10:
Exo 9:10 So they took soot from the kiln and stood before Pharaoh. And Moses threw it in the air, and it became
boils breaking out in sores on man and beast.
9.11:
Exo 9:11 And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils, for the boils came upon the
magicians and upon all the Egyptians.
9.12:
Exo 9:12 But the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he did not listen to them, as the LORD had spoken
to Moses.
9.13:
Exo 9:13 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Rise up early in the morning and present yourself before Pharaoh and
say to him, 'Thus says the LORD, the God of the Hebrews, "Let my people go, that they may serve me.
9.14:
Exo 9:14 For this time I will send all my plagues on you yourself, and on your servants and your people, so that
you may know that there is none like me in all the earth.
9.15:
Exo 9:15 For by now I could have put out my hand and struck you and your people with pestilence, and you
would have been cut off from the earth.
9.16:
Exo 9:16 But for this purpose I have raised you up, to show you my power, so that my name may be proclaimed
in all the earth.
9.17: Exo 9:17 You are still exalting yourself against my people and will not let them go.
9.18:
Exo 9:18 Behold, about this time tomorrow I will cause very heavy hail to fall, such as never has been in Egypt
from the day it was founded until now.
9.19:
Exo 9:19 Now therefore send, get your livestock and all that you have in the field into safe shelter, for every man
and beast that is in the field and is not brought home will die when the hail falls on them."'"
9.20:
Exo 9:20 Then whoever feared the word of the LORD among the servants of Pharaoh hurried his slaves and his
livestock into the houses,
9.21: Exo 9:21 but whoever did not pay attention to the word of the LORD left his slaves and his livestock in the field.
9.22:
Exo 9:22 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Stretch out your hand toward heaven, so that there may be hail in all
the land of Egypt, on man and beast and every plant of the field, in the land of Egypt."
9.23:
Exo 9:23 Then Moses stretched out his staff toward heaven, and the LORD sent thunder and hail, and fire ran
down to the earth. And the LORD rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
9.24:
Exo 9:24 There was hail and fire flashing continually in the midst of the hail, very heavy hail, such as had never
been in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
9.25:
Exo 9:25 The hail struck down everything that was in the field in all the land of Egypt, both man and beast. And
the hail struck down every plant of the field and broke every tree of the field.
9.26: Exo 9:26 Only in the land of Goshen, where the people of Israel were, was there no hail.
9.27:
Exo 9:27 Then Pharaoh sent and called Moses and Aaron and said to them, "This time I have sinned; the LORD
is in the right, and I and my people are in the wrong.
9.28:
Exo 9:28 Plead with the LORD, for there has been enough of God's thunder and hail. I will let you go, and you
shall stay no longer."
9.29:
Exo 9:29 Moses said to him, "As soon as I have gone out of the city, I will stretch out my hands to the LORD.
The thunder will cease, and there will be no more hail, so that you may know that the earth is the LORD's.
9.30: Exo 9:30 But as for you and your servants, I know that you do not yet fear the LORD God."
9.31: Exo 9:31 (The flax and the barley were struck down, for the barley was in the ear and the flax was in bud.
9.32: Exo 9:32 But the wheat and the emmer were not struck down, for they are late in coming up.)
9.33:
Exo 9:33 So Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh and stretched out his hands to the LORD, and the thunder
and the hail ceased, and the rain no longer poured upon the earth.
9.34:
Exo 9:34 But when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunder had ceased, he sinned yet again and
hardened his heart, he and his servants.
9.35:
Exo 9:35 So the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not let the people of Israel go, just as the LORD
had spoken through Moses.

10.1:
Exo 10:1 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Go in to Pharaoh, for I have hardened his heart and the heart of his
servants, that I may show these signs of mine among them,
10.2:
Exo 10:2 and that you may tell in the hearing of your son and of your grandson how I have dealt harshly with the
Egyptians and what signs I have done among them, that you may know that I am the LORD."
10.3:
Exo 10:3 So Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh and said to him, "Thus says the LORD, the God of the
Hebrews, 'How long will you refuse to humble yourself before me? Let my people go, that they may serve me.
10.4: Exo 10:4 For if you refuse to let my people go, behold, tomorrow I will bring locusts into your country,
10.5:
Exo 10:5 and they shall cover the face of the land, so that no one can see the land. And they shall eat what is
left to you after the hail, and they shall eat every tree of yours that grows in the field,
10.6:
Exo 10:6 and they shall fill your houses and the houses of all your servants and of all the Egyptians, as neither
your fathers nor your grandfathers have seen, from the day they came on earth to this day.'"Then he turned and
went out from Pharaoh.
10.7:
Exo 10:7 Then Pharaoh's servants said to him, "How long shall this man be a snare to us? Let the men go, that
they may serve the LORD their God. Do you not yet understand that Egypt is ruined?"
10.8:
Exo 10:8 So Moses and Aaron were brought back to Pharaoh. And he said to them, "Go, serve the LORD your
God. But which ones are to go?"
10.9:
Exo 10:9 Moses said, "We will go with our young and our old. We will go with our sons and daughters and with
our flocks and herds, for we must hold a feast to the LORD."
10.10:
Exo 10:10 But he said to them, "The LORD be with you, if ever I let you and your little ones go! Look, you have
some evil purpose in mind.
10.11:
Exo 10:11 No! Go, the men among you, and serve the LORD, for that is what you are asking." And they were
driven out from Pharaoh's presence.
10.12:
Exo 10:12 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Stretch out your hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, so that
they may come upon the land of Egypt and eat every plant in the land, all that the hail has left."
10.13:
Exo 10:13 So Moses stretched out his staff over the land of Egypt, and the LORD brought an east wind upon
the land all that day and all that night. When it was morning, the east wind had brought the locusts.
10.14:
Exo 10:14 The locusts came up over all the land of Egypt and settled on the whole country of Egypt, such a
dense swarm of locusts as had never been before, nor ever will be again.
10.15:
Exo 10:15 They covered the face of the whole land, so that the land was darkened, and they ate all the plants in
the land and all the fruit of the trees that the hail had left. Not a green thing remained, neither tree nor plant of
the field, through all the land of Egypt.
10.16:
Exo 10:16 Then Pharaoh hastily called Moses and Aaron and said, "I have sinned against the LORD your God,
and against you.
10.17:
Exo 10:17 Now therefore, forgive my sin, please, only this once, and plead with the LORD your God only to
remove this death from me."
10.18: Exo 10:18 So he went out from Pharaoh and pleaded with the LORD.
10.19:
Exo 10:19 And the LORD turned the wind into a very strong west wind, which lifted the locusts and drove them
into the Red Sea. Not a single locust was left in all the country of Egypt.
10.20: Exo 10:20 But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he did not let the people of Israel go.
10.21:
Exo 10:21 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Stretch out your hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness
over the land of Egypt, a darkness to be felt."
10.22:
Exo 10:22 So Moses stretched out his hand toward heaven, and there was pitch darkness in all the land of
Egypt three days.
10.23:
Exo 10:23 They did not see one another, nor did anyone rise from his place for three days, but all the people of
Israel had light where they lived.
10.24:
Exo 10:24 Then Pharaoh called Moses and said, "Go, serve the LORD; your little ones also may go with you;
only let your flocks and your herds remain behind."
10.25:
Exo 10:25 But Moses said, "You must also let us have sacrifices and burnt offerings, that we may sacrifice to
the LORD our God.
10.26: Exo 10:26 Our livestock also must go with us; not a hoof shall be left behind, for we must take of them to servethe LORD our God, and we do not know with what we must serve the LORD until we arrive there."
10.27: Exo 10:27 But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he would not let them go.
10.28:
Exo 10:28 Then Pharaoh said to him, "Get away from me; take care never to see my face again, for on the day
you see my face you shall die."
10.29: Exo 10:29 Moses said, "As you say! I will not see your face again."

11.1:
Exo 11:1 The LORD said to Moses, "Yet one plague more I will bring upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt. Afterward
he will let you go from here. When he lets you go, he will drive you away completely.
11.2:
Exo 11:2 Speak now in the hearing of the people, that they ask, every man of his neighbor and every woman of
her neighbor, for silver and gold jewelry."
11.3:
Exo 11:3 And the LORD gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover, the man Moses was very
great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh's servants and in the sight of the people.
11.4: Exo 11:4 So Moses said, "Thus says the LORD: About midnight I will go out in the midst of Egypt,
11.5:
Exo 11:5 and every firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sits on his throne,
even to the firstborn of the slave girl who is behind the hand mill, and all the firstborn of the cattle.
11.6:
Exo 11:6 There shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there has never been, nor ever will
be again.
11.7:
Exo 11:7 But not a dog shall growl against any of the people of Israel, either man or beast, that you may know
that the LORD makes a distinction between Egypt and Israel.
11.8:
Exo 11:8 And all these your servants shall come down to me and bow down to me, saying, 'Get out, you and all
the people who follow you.' And after that I will go out." And he went out from Pharaoh in hot anger.
11.9:
Exo 11:9 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Pharaoh will not listen to you, that my wonders may be multiplied in
the land of Egypt."
11.10:
Exo 11:10 Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh, and the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart,
and he did not let the people of Israel go out of his land.

12.1: Exo 12:1 The LORD said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt,
12.2: Exo 12:2 "This month shall be for you the beginning of months. It shall be the first month of the year for you.
12.3:
Exo 12:3 Tell all the congregation of Israel that on the tenth day of this month every man shall take a lamb
according to their fathers' houses, a lamb for a household.
12.4:
Exo 12:4 And if the household is too small for a lamb, then he and his nearest neighbor shall take according to
the number of persons; according to what each can eat you shall make your count for the lamb.
12.5:
Exo 12:5 Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male a year old. You may take it from the sheep or from the
goats,
12.6:
Exo 12:6 and you shall keep it until the fourteenth day of this month, when the whole assembly of the
congregation of Israel shall kill their lambs at twilight.
12.7:
Exo 12:7 "Then they shall take some of the blood and put it on the two doorposts and the lintel of the houses in
which they eat it.
12.8:
Exo 12:8 They shall eat the flesh that night, roasted on the fire; with unleavened bread and bitter herbs they
shall eat it.
12.9: Exo 12:9 Do not eat any of it raw or boiled in water, but roasted, its head with its legs and its inner parts.
12.10:
Exo 12:10 And you shall let none of it remain until the morning; anything that remains until the morning you shall
burn.
12.11:
Exo 12:11 In this manner you shall eat it: with your belt fastened, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in
your hand. And you shall eat it in haste. It is the LORD's Passover.
12.12:
Exo 12:12 For I will pass through the land of Egypt that night, and I will strike all the firstborn in the land of
Egypt, both man and beast; and on all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgments: I am the LORD.
12.13:
Exo 12:13 The blood shall be a sign for you, on the houses where you are. And when I see the blood, I will pass
over you, and no plague will befall you to destroy you, when I strike the land of Egypt.
12.14:
Exo 12:14 "This day shall be for you a memorial day, and you shall keep it as a feast to the LORD; throughout
your generations, as a statute forever, you shall keep it as a feast.
12.15:
Exo 12:15 Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread. On the first day you shall remove leaven out of your
houses, for if anyone eats what is leavened, from the first day until the seventh day, that person shall be cut off
from Israel.
12.16:
Exo 12:16 On the first day you shall hold a holy assembly, and on the seventh day a holy assembly. No work
shall be done on those days. But what everyone needs to eat, that alone may be prepared by you.
12.17:
Exo 12:17 And you shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread, for on this very day I brought your hosts out
of the land of Egypt. Therefore you shall observe this day, throughout your generations, as a statute forever.
12.18:
Exo 12:18 In the first month, from the fourteenth day of the month at evening, you shall eat unleavened bread
until the twenty-first day of the month at evening.
12.19: Exo 12:19 For seven days no leaven is to be found in your houses. If anyone eats what is leavened, that personwill be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he is a sojourner or a native of the land.
12.20: Exo 12:20 You shall eat nothing leavened; in all your dwelling places you shall eat unleavened bread."
12.21:
Exo 12:21 Then Moses called all the elders of Israel and said to them, "Go and select lambs for yourselves
according to your clans, and kill the Passover lamb.
12.22:
Exo 12:22 Take a bunch of hyssop and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and touch the lintel and the two
doorposts with the blood that is in the basin. None of you shall go out of the door of his house until the morning.
12.23:
Exo 12:23 For the LORD will pass through to strike the Egyptians, and when he sees the blood on the lintel and
on the two doorposts, the LORD will pass over the door and will not allow the destroyer to enter your houses to
strike you.
12.24: Exo 12:24 You shall observe this rite as a statute for you and for your sons forever.
12.25:
Exo 12:25 And when you come to the land that the LORD will give you, as he has promised, you shall keep this
service.
12.26: Exo 12:26 And when your children say to you, 'What do you mean by this service?'
12.27:
Exo 12:27 you shall say, 'It is the sacrifice of the LORD's Passover, for he passed over the houses of the people
of Israel in Egypt, when he struck the Egyptians but spared our houses.'"And the people bowed their heads and
worshiped.
12.28:
Exo 12:28 Then the people of Israel went and did so; as the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they
did.
12.29:
Exo 12:29 At midnight the LORD struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh
who sat on his throne to the firstborn of the captive who was in the dungeon, and all the firstborn of the livestock.
12.30:
Exo 12:30 And Pharaoh rose up in the night, he and all his servants and all the Egyptians. And there was a
great cry in Egypt, for there was not a house where someone was not dead.
12.31:
Exo 12:31 Then he summoned Moses and Aaron by night and said, "Up, go out from among my people, both
you and the people of Israel; and go, serve the LORD, as you have said.
12.32: Exo 12:32 Take your flocks and your herds, as you have said, and be gone, and bless me also!"
12.33:
Exo 12:33 The Egyptians were urgent with the people to send them out of the land in haste. For they said, "We
shall all be dead."
12.34:
Exo 12:34 So the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading bowls being bound up in their
cloaks on their shoulders.
12.35:
Exo 12:35 The people of Israel had also done as Moses told them, for they had asked the Egyptians for silver
and gold jewelry and for clothing.
12.36:
Exo 12:36 And the LORD had given the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they let them have
what they asked. Thus they plundered the Egyptians.
12.37:
Exo 12:37 And the people of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand men on
foot, besides women and children.
12.38: Exo 12:38 A mixed multitude also went up with them, and very much livestock, both flocks and herds.
12.39:
Exo 12:39 And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough that they had brought out of Egypt, for it was not
leavened, because they were thrust out of Egypt and could not wait, nor had they prepared any provisions for
themselves.
12.40: Exo 12:40 The time that the people of Israel lived in Egypt was 430 years.
12.41: Exo 12:41 At the end of 430 years, on that very day, all the hosts of the LORD went out from the land of Egypt.
12.42:
Exo 12:42 It was a night of watching by the LORD, to bring them out of the land of Egypt; so this same night is a
night of watching kept to the LORD by all the people of Israel throughout their generations.
12.43:
Exo 12:43 And the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, "This is the statute of the Passover: no foreigner shall eat of
it,
12.44: Exo 12:44 but every slave that is bought for money may eat of it after you have circumcised him.
12.45: Exo 12:45 No foreigner or hired servant may eat of it.
12.46:
Exo 12:46 It shall be eaten in one house; you shall not take any of the flesh outside the house, and you shall not
break any of its bones.
12.47: Exo 12:47 All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.
12.48:
Exo 12:48 If a stranger shall sojourn with you and would keep the Passover to the LORD, let all his males be
circumcised. Then he may come near and keep it; he shall be as a native of the land. But no uncircumcised
person shall eat of it.
12.49: Exo 12:49 There shall be one law for the native and for the stranger who sojourns among you."
12.50: Exo 12:50 All the people of Israel did just as the LORD commanded Moses and Aaron.
12.51: Exo 12:51 And on that very day the LORD brought the people of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their hosts.

13.1: Exo 13:1 The LORD said to Moses,
13.2:
Exo 13:2 "Consecrate to me all the firstborn. Whatever is the first to open the womb among the people of Israel,
both of man and of beast, is mine."
13.3:
Exo 13:3 Then Moses said to the people, "Remember this day in which you came out from Egypt, out of the
house of slavery, for by strength of hand the LORD brought you out from this place. No leavened bread shall be
eaten.
13.4: Exo 13:4 Today, in the month of Abib, you are going out.
13.5:
Exo 13:5 And when the LORD brings you into the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Hivites,
and the Jebusites, which he swore to your fathers to give you, a land flowing with milk and honey, you shall keep
this service in this month.
13.6:
Exo 13:6 Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a feast to the
LORD.
13.7:
Exo 13:7 Unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days; no leavened bread shall be seen with you, and no
leaven shall be seen with you in all your territory.
13.8:
Exo 13:8 You shall tell your son on that day, 'It is because of what the LORD did for me when I came out of
Egypt.'
13.9:
Exo 13:9 And it shall be to you as a sign on your hand and as a memorial between your eyes, that the law of the
LORD may be in your mouth. For with a strong hand the LORD has brought you out of Egypt.
13.10: Exo 13:10 You shall therefore keep this statute at its appointed time from year to year.
13.11:
Exo 13:11 "When the LORD brings you into the land of the Canaanites, as he swore to you and your fathers,
and shall give it to you,
13.12:
Exo 13:12 you shall set apart to the LORD all that first opens the womb. All the firstborn of your animals that are
males shall be the LORD's.
13.13:
Exo 13:13 Every firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb, or if you will not redeem it you shall break
its neck. Every firstborn of man among your sons you shall redeem.
13.14:
Exo 13:14 And when in time to come your son asks you, 'What does this mean?' you shall say to him, 'By
strength of hand the LORD brought us out of Egypt, from the house of slavery.
13.15:
Exo 13:15 For when Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, the LORD killed all the firstborn in the land of
Egypt, both the firstborn of man and the firstborn of animals. Therefore I sacrifice to the LORD all the males that
first open the womb, but all the firstborn of my sons I redeem.'
13.16:
Exo 13:16 It shall be as a mark on your hand or frontlets between your eyes, for by a strong hand the LORD
brought us out of Egypt."
13.17:
Exo 13:17 When Pharaoh let the people go, God did not lead them by way of the land of the Philistines,
although that was near. For God said, "Lest the people change their minds when they see war and return to
Egypt."
13.18:
Exo 13:18 But God led the people around by the way of the wilderness toward the Red Sea. And the people of
Israel went up out of the land of Egypt equipped for battle.
13.19:
Exo 13:19 Moses took the bones of Joseph with him, for Joseph had made the sons of Israel solemnly swear,
saying, "God will surely visit you, and you shall carry up my bones with you from here."
13.20: Exo 13:20 And they moved on from Succoth and encamped at Etham, on the edge of the wilderness.
13.21:
Exo 13:21 And the LORD went before them by day in a pillar of cloud to lead them along the way, and by night
in a pillar of fire to give them light, that they might travel by day and by night.
13.22: Exo 13:22 The pillar of cloud by day and the pillar of fire by night did not depart from before the people.

14.1: Exo 14:1 Then the LORD said to Moses,
14.2:
Exo 14:2 "Tell the people of Israel to turn back and encamp in front of Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea,
in front of Baal-zephon; you shall encamp facing it, by the sea.
14.3:
Exo 14:3 For Pharaoh will say of the people of Israel, 'They are wandering in the land; the wilderness has shut
them in.'
14.4:
Exo 14:4 And I will harden Pharaoh's heart, and he will pursue them, and I will get glory over Pharaoh and all
his host, and the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD." And they did so.
14.5:
Exo 14:5 When the king of Egypt was told that the people had fled, the mind of Pharaoh and his servants was
changed toward the people, and they said, "What is this we have done, that we have let Israel go from serving
us?"
14.6: Exo 14:6 So he made ready his chariot and took his army with him,
14.7: Exo 14:7 and took six hundred chosen chariots and all the other chariots of Egypt with officers over all of them.
14.8:
Exo 14:8 And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued the people of Israel while
the people of Israel were going out defiantly.
14.9:
Exo 14:9 The Egyptians pursued them, all Pharaoh's horses and chariots and his horsemen and his army, and
overtook them encamped at the sea, by Pi-hahiroth, in front of Baal-zephon.
14.10:
Exo 14:10 When Pharaoh drew near, the people of Israel lifted up their eyes, and behold, the Egyptians were
marching after them, and they feared greatly. And the people of Israel cried out to the LORD.
14.11: Exo 14:11 They said to Moses, "Is it because there are no graves in Egypt that you have taken us away to die inthe wilderness? What have you done to us in bringing us out of Egypt?
14.12:
Exo 14:12 Is not this what we said to you in Egypt, 'Leave us alone that we may serve the Egyptians'? For it
would have been better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the wilderness."
14.13:
Exo 14:13 And Moses said to the people, "Fear not, stand firm, and see the salvation of the LORD, which he will
work for you today. For the Egyptians whom you see today, you shall never see again.
14.14: Exo 14:14 The LORD will fight for you, and you have only to be silent."
14.15: Exo 14:15 The LORD said to Moses, "Why do you cry to me? Tell the people of Israel to go forward.
14.16:
Exo 14:16 Lift up your staff, and stretch out your hand over the sea and divide it, that the people of Israel may
go through the sea on dry ground.
14.17:
Exo 14:17 And I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians so that they shall go in after them, and I will get glory
over Pharaoh and all his host, his chariots, and his horsemen.
14.18:
Exo 14:18 And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I have gotten glory over Pharaoh, his
chariots, and his horsemen."
14.19:
Exo 14:19 Then the angel of God who was going before the host of Israel moved and went behind them, and
the pillar of cloud moved from before them and stood behind them,
14.20:
Exo 14:20 coming between the host of Egypt and the host of Israel. And there was the cloud and the darkness.
And it lit up the night without one coming near the other all night.
14.21:
Exo 14:21 Then Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and the LORD drove the sea back by a strong east
wind all night and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.
14.22:
Exo 14:22 And the people of Israel went into the midst of the sea on dry ground, the waters being a wall to them
on their right hand and on their left.
14.23:
Exo 14:23 The Egyptians pursued and went in after them into the midst of the sea, all Pharaoh's horses, his
chariots, and his horsemen.
14.24:
Exo 14:24 And in the morning watch the LORD in the pillar of fire and of cloud looked down on the Egyptian
forces and threw the Egyptian forces into a panic,
14.25:
Exo 14:25 clogging their chariot wheels so that they drove heavily. And the Egyptians said, "Let us flee from
before Israel, for the LORD fights for them against the Egyptians."
14.26:
Exo 14:26 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Stretch out your hand over the sea, that the water may come back
upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen."
14.27:
Exo 14:27 So Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to its normal course when the
morning appeared. And as the Egyptians fled into it, the LORD threw the Egyptians into the midst of the sea.
14.28:
Exo 14:28 The waters returned and covered the chariots and the horsemen; of all the host of Pharaoh that had
followed them into the sea, not one of them remained.
14.29:
Exo 14:29 But the people of Israel walked on dry ground through the sea, the waters being a wall to them on
their right hand and on their left.
14.30:
Exo 14:30 Thus the LORD saved Israel that day from the hand of the Egyptians, and Israel saw the Egyptians
dead on the seashore.
14.31:
Exo 14:31 Israel saw the great power that the LORD used against the Egyptians, so the people feared the
LORD, and they believed in the LORD and in his servant Moses.

15.1:
Exo 15:1 Then Moses and the people of Israel sang this song to the LORD, saying, "I will sing to the LORD, for
he has triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider he has thrown into the sea.
15.2:
Exo 15:2 The LORD is my strength and my song, and he has become my salvation; this is my God, and I will
praise him, my father's God, and I will exalt him.
15.3: Exo 15:3 The LORD is a man of war; the LORD is his name.
15.4:
Exo 15:4 "Pharaoh's chariots and his host he cast into the sea, and his chosen officers were sunk in the Red
Sea.
15.5: Exo 15:5 The floods covered them; they went down into the depths like a stone.
15.6: Exo 15:6 Your right hand, O LORD, glorious in power, your right hand, O LORD, shatters the enemy.
15.7:
Exo 15:7 In the greatness of your majesty you overthrow your adversaries; you send out your fury; it consumes
them like stubble.
15.8:
Exo 15:8 At the blast of your nostrils the waters piled up; the floods stood up in a heap; the deeps congealed in
the heart of the sea.
15.9:
Exo 15:9 The enemy said, 'I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil, my desire shall have its fill of them.
I will draw my sword; my hand shall destroy them.'
15.10: Exo 15:10 You blew with your wind; the sea covered them; they sank like lead in the mighty waters.
15.11:
Exo 15:11 "Who is like you, O LORD, among the gods? Who is like you, majestic in holiness, awesome in
glorious deeds, doing wonders?
15.12: Exo 15:12 You stretched out your right hand; the earth swallowed them.
15.13: Exo 15:13 "You have led in your steadfast love the people whom you have redeemed; you have guided them byyour strength to your holy abode.
15.14: Exo 15:14 The peoples have heard; they tremble; pangs have seized the inhabitants of Philistia.
15.15:
Exo 15:15 Now are the chiefs of Edom dismayed; trembling seizes the leaders of Moab; all the inhabitants of
Canaan have melted away.
15.16:
Exo 15:16 Terror and dread fall upon them; because of the greatness of your arm, they are still as a stone, till
your people, O LORD, pass by, till the people pass by whom you have purchased.
15.17:
Exo 15:17 You will bring them in and plant them on your own mountain, the place, O LORD, which you have
made for your abode, the sanctuary, O Lord, which your hands have established.
15.18: Exo 15:18 The LORD will reign forever and ever."
15.19:
Exo 15:19 For when the horses of Pharaoh with his chariots and his horsemen went into the sea, the LORD
brought back the waters of the sea upon them, but the people of Israel walked on dry ground in the midst of the
sea.
15.20:
Exo 15:20 Then Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a tambourine in her hand, and all the women
went out after her with tambourines and dancing.
15.21:
Exo 15:21 And Miriam sang to them: "Sing to the LORD, for he has triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider
he has thrown into the sea."
15.22:
Exo 15:22 Then Moses made Israel set out from the Red Sea, and they went into the wilderness of Shur. They
went three days in the wilderness and found no water.
15.23:
Exo 15:23 When they came to Marah, they could not drink the water of Marah because it was bitter; therefore it
was named Marah.
15.24: Exo 15:24 And the people grumbled against Moses, saying, "What shall we drink?"
15.25:
Exo 15:25 And he cried to the LORD, and the LORD showed him a log, and he threw it into the water, and the
water became sweet. There the LORD made for them a statute and a rule, and there he tested them,
15.26:
Exo 15:26 saying, "If you will diligently listen to the voice of the LORD your God, and do that which is right in his
eyes, and give ear to his commandments and keep all his statutes, I will put none of the diseases on you that I
put on the Egyptians, for I am the LORD, your healer."
15.27:
Exo 15:27 Then they came to Elim, where there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, and they
encamped there by the water.

16.1:
Exo 16:1 They set out from Elim, and all the congregation of the people of Israel came to the wilderness of Sin,
which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after they had departed from the land
of Egypt.
16.2:
Exo 16:2 And the whole congregation of the people of Israel grumbled against Moses and Aaron in the
wilderness,
16.3:
Exo 16:3 and the people of Israel said to them, "Would that we had died by the hand of the LORD in the land of
Egypt, when we sat by the meat pots and ate bread to the full, for you have brought us out into this wilderness to
kill this whole assembly with hunger."
16.4:
Exo 16:4 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Behold, I am about to rain bread from heaven for you, and the people
shall go out and gather a day's portion every day, that I may test them, whether they will walk in my law or not.
16.5: Exo 16:5 On the sixth day, when they prepare what they bring in, it will be twice as much as they gather daily."
16.6:
Exo 16:6 So Moses and Aaron said to all the people of Israel, "At evening you shall know that it was the LORD
who brought you out of the land of Egypt,
16.7:
Exo 16:7 and in the morning you shall see the glory of the LORD, because he has heard your grumbling against
the LORD. For what are we, that you grumble against us?"
16.8:
Exo 16:8 And Moses said, "When the LORD gives you in the evening meat to eat and in the morning bread to
the full, because the LORD has heard your grumbling that you grumble against him- what are we? Your
grumbling is not against us but against the LORD."
16.9:
Exo 16:9 Then Moses said to Aaron, "Say to the whole congregation of the people of Israel, 'Come near before
the LORD, for he has heard your grumbling.'"
16.10:
Exo 16:10 And as soon as Aaron spoke to the whole congregation of the people of Israel, they looked toward
the wilderness, and behold, the glory of the LORD appeared in the cloud.
16.11: Exo 16:11 And the LORD said to Moses,
16.12:
Exo 16:12 "I have heard the grumbling of the people of Israel. Say to them, 'At twilight you shall eat meat, and in
the morning you shall be filled with bread. Then you shall know that I am the LORD your God.'"
16.13: Exo 16:13 In the evening quail came up and covered the camp, and in the morning dew lay around the camp.
16.14:
Exo 16:14 And when the dew had gone up, there was on the face of the wilderness a fine, flake-like thing, fine
as frost on the ground.
16.15:
Exo 16:15 When the people of Israel saw it, they said to one another, "What is it?" For they did not know what it
was. And Moses said to them, "It is the bread that the LORD has given you to eat.
16.16: Exo 16:16 This is what the LORD has commanded: 'Gather of it, each one of you, as much as he can eat. Youshall each take an omer, according to the number of the persons that each of you has in his tent.'"
16.17: Exo 16:17 And the people of Israel did so. They gathered, some more, some less.
16.18:
Exo 16:18 But when they measured it with an omer, whoever gathered much had nothing left over, and whoever
gathered little had no lack. Each of them gathered as much as he could eat.
16.19: Exo 16:19 And Moses said to them, "Let no one leave any of it over till the morning."
16.20:
Exo 16:20 But they did not listen to Moses. Some left part of it till the morning, and it bred worms and stank. And
Moses was angry with them.
16.21:
Exo 16:21 Morning by morning they gathered it, each as much as he could eat; but when the sun grew hot, it
melted.
16.22:
Exo 16:22 On the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers each. And when all the leaders of
the congregation came and told Moses,
16.23:
Exo 16:23 he said to them, "This is what the LORD has commanded: 'Tomorrow is a day of solemn rest, a holy
Sabbath to the LORD; bake what you will bake and boil what you will boil, and all that is left over lay aside to be
kept till the morning.'"
16.24:
Exo 16:24 So they laid it aside till the morning, as Moses commanded them, and it did not stink, and there were
no worms in it.
16.25: Exo 16:25 Moses said, "Eat it today, for today is a Sabbath to the LORD; today you will not find it in the field.
16.26: Exo 16:26 Six days you shall gather it, but on the seventh day, which is a Sabbath, there will be none."
16.27: Exo 16:27 On the seventh day some of the people went out to gather, but they found none.
16.28: Exo 16:28 And the LORD said to Moses, "How long will you refuse to keep my commandments and my laws?
16.29:
Exo 16:29 See! The LORD has given you the Sabbath; therefore on the sixth day he gives you bread for two
days. Remain each of you in his place; let no one go out of his place on the seventh day."
16.30: Exo 16:30 So the people rested on the seventh day.
16.31:
Exo 16:31 Now the house of Israel called its name manna. It was like coriander seed, white, and the taste of it
was like wafers made with honey.
16.32:
Exo 16:32 Moses said, "This is what the LORD has commanded: 'Let an omer of it be kept throughout your
generations, so that they may see the bread with which I fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you out of the
land of Egypt.'"
16.33:
Exo 16:33 And Moses said to Aaron, "Take a jar, and put an omer of manna in it, and place it before the LORD
to be kept throughout your generations."
16.34: Exo 16:34 As the LORD commanded Moses, so Aaron placed it before the testimony to be kept.
16.35:
Exo 16:35 The people of Israel ate the manna forty years, till they came to a habitable land. They ate the manna
till they came to the border of the land of Canaan.
16.36: Exo 16:36 (An omer is the tenth part of an ephah.)

17.1:
Exo 17:1 All the congregation of the people of Israel moved on from the wilderness of Sin by stages, according
to the commandment of the LORD, and camped at Rephidim, but there was no water for the people to drink.
17.2:
Exo 17:2 Therefore the people quarreled with Moses and said, "Give us water to drink." And Moses said to
them, "Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you test the LORD?"
17.3:
Exo 17:3 But the people thirsted there for water, and the people grumbled against Moses and said, "Why did
you bring us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our livestock with thirst?"
17.4: Exo 17:4 So Moses cried to the LORD, "What shall I do with this people? They are almost ready to stone me."
17.5:
Exo 17:5 And the LORD said to Moses, "Pass on before the people, taking with you some of the elders of Israel,
and take in your hand the staff with which you struck the Nile, and go.
17.6:
Exo 17:6 Behold, I will stand before you there on the rock at Horeb, and you shall strike the rock, and water
shall come out of it, and the people will drink." And Moses did so, in the sight of the elders of Israel.
17.7:
Exo 17:7 And he called the name of the place Massah and Meribah, because of the quarreling of the people of
Israel, and because they tested the LORD by saying, "Is the LORD among us or not?"
17.8: Exo 17:8 Then Amalek came and fought with Israel at Rephidim.
17.9:
Exo 17:9 So Moses said to Joshua, "Choose for us men, and go out and fight with Amalek. Tomorrow I will
stand on the top of the hill with the staff of God in my hand."
17.10:
Exo 17:10 So Joshua did as Moses told him, and fought with Amalek, while Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to
the top of the hill.
17.11:
Exo 17:11 Whenever Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed, and whenever he lowered his hand, Amalek
prevailed.
17.12:
Exo 17:12 But Moses' hands grew weary, so they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat on it, while
Aaron and Hur held up his hands, one on one side, and the other on the other side. So his hands were steady
until the going down of the sun.
17.13: Exo 17:13 And Joshua overwhelmed Amalek and his people with the sword.
17.14: Exo 17:14 Then the LORD said to Moses, "Write this as a memorial in a book and recite it in the ears of Joshua,that I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven."
17.15: Exo 17:15 And Moses built an altar and called the name of it, The LORD is my banner,
17.16:
Exo 17:16 saying, "A hand upon the throne of the LORD! The LORD will have war with Amalek from generation
to generation."

18.1:
Exo 18:1 Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses' father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses and for
Israel his people, how the LORD had brought Israel out of Egypt.
18.2: Exo 18:2 Now Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, had taken Zipporah, Moses' wife, after he had sent her home,
18.3:
Exo 18:3 along with her two sons. The name of the one was Gershom ( for he said, "I have been a sojourner in
a foreign land"),
18.4:
Exo 18:4 and the name of the other, Eliezer (for he said, "The God of my father was my help, and delivered me
from the sword of Pharaoh").
18.5:
Exo 18:5 Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife to Moses in the wilderness where he was
encamped at the mountain of God.
18.6:
Exo 18:6 And when he sent word to Moses, "I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you with your wife and
her two sons with her,"
18.7:
Exo 18:7 Moses went out to meet his father-in-law and bowed down and kissed him. And they asked each other
of their welfare and went into the tent.
18.8:
Exo 18:8 Then Moses told his father-in-law all that the LORD had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for
Israel's sake, all the hardship that had come upon them in the way, and how the LORD had delivered them.
18.9:
Exo 18:9 And Jethro rejoiced for all the good that the LORD had done to Israel, in that he had delivered them
out of the hand of the Egyptians.
18.10:
Exo 18:10 Jethro said, "Blessed be the LORD, who has delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians and out
of the hand of Pharaoh and has delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
18.11:
Exo 18:11 Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods, because in this affair they dealt arrogantly with
the people."
18.12:
Exo 18:12 And Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and sacrifices to God; and Aaron came
with all the elders of Israel to eat bread with Moses' father-in-law before God.
18.13:
Exo 18:13 The next day Moses sat to judge the people, and the people stood around Moses from morning till
evening.
18.14:
Exo 18:14 When Moses' father-in-law saw all that he was doing for the people, he said, "What is this that you
are doing for the people? Why do you sit alone, and all the people stand around you from morning till evening?"
18.15: Exo 18:15 And Moses said to his father-in-law, "Because the people come to me to inquire of God;
18.16:
Exo 18:16 when they have a dispute, they come to me and I decide between one person and another, and I
make them know the statutes of God and his laws."
18.17: Exo 18:17 Moses' father-in-law said to him, "What you are doing is not good.
18.18:
Exo 18:18 You and the people with you will certainly wear yourselves out, for the thing is too heavy for you. You
are not able to do it alone.
18.19:
Exo 18:19 Now obey my voice; I will give you advice, and God be with you! You shall represent the people
before God and bring their cases to God,
18.20:
Exo 18:20 and you shall warn them about the statutes and the laws, and make them know the way in which they
must walk and what they must do.
18.21:
Exo 18:21 Moreover, look for able men from all the people, men who fear God, who are trustworthy and hate a
bribe, and place such men over the people as chiefs of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties, and of tens.
18.22:
Exo 18:22 And let them judge the people at all times. Every great matter they shall bring to you, but any small
matter they shall decide themselves. So it will be easier for you, and they will bear the burden with you.
18.23:
Exo 18:23 If you do this, God will direct you, you will be able to endure, and all this people also will go to their
place in peace."
18.24: Exo 18:24 So Moses listened to the voice of his father-in-law and did all that he had said.
18.25:
Exo 18:25 Moses chose able men out of all Israel and made them heads over the people, chiefs of thousands,
of hundreds, of fifties, and of tens.
18.26:
Exo 18:26 And they judged the people at all times. Any hard case they brought to Moses, but any small matter
they decided themselves.
18.27: Exo 18:27 Then Moses let his father-in-law depart, and he went away to his own country.

19.1:
Exo 19:1 On the third new moon after the people of Israel had gone out of the land of Egypt, on that day they
came into the wilderness of Sinai.
19.2:
Exo 19:2 They set out from Rephidim and came into the wilderness of Sinai, and they encamped in the
wilderness. There Israel encamped before the mountain,
19.3:
Exo 19:3 while Moses went up to God. The LORD called to him out of the mountain, saying, "Thus you shall say
to the house of Jacob, and tell the people of Israel:
19.4:
Exo 19:4 You yourselves have seen what I did to the Egyptians, and how I bore you on eagles' wings and
brought you to myself.
19.5:
Exo 19:5 Now therefore, if you will indeed obey my voice and keep my covenant, you shall be my treasured
possession among all peoples, for all the earth is mine;
19.6:
Exo 19:6 and you shall be to me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation. These are the words that you shall
speak to the people of Israel."
19.7:
Exo 19:7 So Moses came and called the elders of the people and set before them all these words that the
LORD had commanded him.
19.8:
Exo 19:8 All the people answered together and said, "All that the LORD has spoken we will do." And Moses
reported the words of the people to the LORD.
19.9:
Exo 19:9 And the LORD said to Moses. "Behold, I am coming to you in a thick cloud, that the people may hear
when I speak with you, and may also believe you forever." When Moses told the words of the people to the
LORD,
19.10:
Exo 19:10 the LORD said to Moses, "Go to the people and consecrate them today and tomorrow, and let them
wash their garments
19.11:
Exo 19:11 and be ready for the third day. For on the third day the LORD will come down on Mount Sinai in the
sight of all the people.
19.12:
Exo 19:12 And you shall set limits for the people all around, saying, 'Take care not to go up into the mountain or
touch the edge of it. Whoever touches the mountain shall be put to death.
19.13:
Exo 19:13 No hand shall touch him, but he shall be stoned or shot; whether beast or man, he shall not live.'
When the trumpet sounds a long blast, they shall come up to the mountain."
19.14:
Exo 19:14 So Moses went down from the mountain to the people and consecrated the people; and they washed
their garments.
19.15: Exo 19:15 And he said to the people, "Be ready for the third day; do not go near a woman."
19.16:
Exo 19:16 On the morning of the third day there were thunders and lightnings and a thick cloud on the mountain
and a very loud trumpet blast, so that all the people in the camp trembled.
19.17:
Exo 19:17 Then Moses brought the people out of the camp to meet God, and they took their stand at the foot of
the mountain.
19.18:
Exo 19:18 Now Mount Sinai was wrapped in smoke because the LORD had descended on it in fire. The smoke
of it went up like the smoke of a kiln, and the whole mountain trembled greatly.
19.19:
Exo 19:19 And as the sound of the trumpet grew louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him in
thunder.
19.20:
Exo 19:20 The LORD came down on Mount Sinai, to the top of the mountain. And the LORD called Moses to
the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.
19.21:
Exo 19:21 And the LORD said to Moses, "Go down and warn the people, lest they break through to the LORD
to look and many of them perish.
19.22:
Exo 19:22 Also let the priests who come near to the LORD consecrate themselves, lest the LORD break out
against them."
19.23:
Exo 19:23 And Moses said to the LORD, "The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai, for you yourself warned
us, saying, 'Set limits around the mountain and consecrate it.'"
19.24:
Exo 19:24 And the LORD said to him, "Go down, and come up bringing Aaron with you. But do not let the
priests and the people break through to come up to the LORD, lest he break out against them."
19.25: Exo 19:25 So Moses went down to the people and told them.

20.1: Exo 20:1 And God spoke all these words, saying,
20.2: Exo 20:2 "I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
20.3: Exo 20:3 "You shall have no other gods before me.
20.4:
Exo 20:4 "You shall not make for yourself a carved image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above,
or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth.
20.5:
Exo 20:5 You shall not bow down to them or serve them, for I the LORD your God am a jealous God, visiting the
iniquity of the fathers on the children to the third and the fourth generation of those who hate me,
20.6: Exo 20:6 but showing steadfast love to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.
20.7:
Exo 20:7 "You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain, for the LORD will not hold him guiltless
who takes his name in vain.
20.8: Exo 20:8 "Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
20.9: Exo 20:9 Six days you shall labor, and do all your work,
20.10:
