Exo 20:10 but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the LORD your God. On it you shall not do any work, you, or
your son, or your daughter, your male servant, or your female servant, or your livestock, or the sojourner who is
within your gates.
20.11: Exo 20:11 For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested theseventh day. Therefore the LORD blessed the Sabbath day and made it holy.
20.12:
Exo 20:12 "Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long in the land that the LORD your God
is giving you.
20.16: Exo 20:16 "You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
20.17:
Exo 20:17 "You shall not covet your neighbor's house; you shall not covet your neighbor's wife, or his male
servant, or his female servant, or his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor's."
20.18:
Exo 20:18 Now when all the people saw the thunder and the flashes of lightning and the sound of the trumpet
and the mountain smoking, the people were afraid and trembled, and they stood far off
20.19: Exo 20:19 and said to Moses, "You speak to us, and we will listen; but do not let God speak to us, lest we die."
20.20:
Exo 20:20 Moses said to the people, "Do not fear, for God has come to test you, that the fear of him may be
before you, that you may not sin."
20.21: Exo 20:21 The people stood far off, while Moses drew near to the thick darkness where God was.
20.22:
Exo 20:22 And the LORD said to Moses, "Thus you shall say to the people of Israel: 'You have seen for
yourselves that I have talked with you from heaven.
20.23: Exo 20:23 You shall not make gods of silver to be with me, nor shall you make for yourselves gods of gold.
20.24:
Exo 20:24 An altar of earth you shall make for me and sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your peace
offerings, your sheep and your oxen. In every place where I cause my name to be remembered I will come to
you and bless you.
20.25:
Exo 20:25 If you make me an altar of stone, you shall not build it of hewn stones, for if you wield your tool on it
you profane it.
20.26: Exo 20:26 And you shall not go up by steps to my altar, that your nakedness be not exposed on it.'

21.1: Exo 21:1 "Now these are the rules that you shall set before them.
21.2:
Exo 21:2 When you buy a Hebrew slave, he shall serve six years, and in the seventh he shall go out free, for
nothing.
21.3: Exo 21:3 If he comes in single, he shall go out single; if he comes in married, then his wife shall go out with him.
21.4:
Exo 21:4 If his master gives him a wife and she bears him sons or daughters, the wife and her children shall be
her master's, and he shall go out alone.
21.5: Exo 21:5 But if the slave plainly says, 'I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free,'
21.6:
Exo 21:6 then his master shall bring him to God, and he shall bring him to the door or the doorpost. And his
master shall bore his ear through with an awl, and he shall be his slave forever.
21.7: Exo 21:7 "When a man sells his daughter as a slave, she shall not go out as the male slaves do.
21.8:
Exo 21:8 If she does not please her master, who has designated her for himself, then he shall let her be
redeemed. He shall have no right to sell her to a foreign people, since he has broken faith with her.
21.9: Exo 21:9 If he designates her for his son, he shall deal with her as with a daughter.
21.10: Exo 21:10 If he takes another wife to himself, he shall not diminish her food, her clothing, or her marital rights.
21.11:
Exo 21:11 And if he does not do these three things for her, she shall go out for nothing, without payment of
money.
21.12: Exo 21:12 "Whoever strikes a man so that he dies shall be put to death.
21.13:
Exo 21:13 But if he did not lie in wait for him, but God let him fall into his hand, then I will appoint for you a place
to which he may flee.
21.14:
Exo 21:14 But if a man willfully attacks another to kill him by cunning, you shall take him from my altar, that he
may die.
21.15: Exo 21:15 "Whoever strikes his father or his mother shall be put to death.
21.16: Exo 21:16 "Whoever steals a man and sells him, and anyone found in possession of him, shall be put to death.
21.17: Exo 21:17 "Whoever curses his father or his mother shall be put to death.
21.18:
Exo 21:18 "When men quarrel and one strikes the other with a stone or with his fist and the man does not die
but takes to his bed,
21.19:
Exo 21:19 then if the man rises again and walks outdoors with his staff, he who struck him shall be clear; only
he shall pay for the loss of his time, and shall have him thoroughly healed.
21.20:
Exo 21:20 "When a man strikes his slave, male or female, with a rod and the slave dies under his hand, he shall
be avenged.
21.21: Exo 21:21 But if the slave survives a day or two, he is not to be avenged, for the slave is his money.
21.22:
Exo 21:22 "When men strive together and hit a pregnant woman, so that her children come out, but there is no
harm, the one who hit her shall surely be fined, as the woman's husband shall impose on him, and he shall pay
as the judges determine.
21.23: Exo 21:23 But if there is harm, then you shall pay life for life,
21.24: Exo 21:24 eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
21.25: Exo 21:25 burn for burn, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
21.26:
Exo 21:26 "When a man strikes the eye of his slave, male or female, and destroys it, he shall let the slave go
free because of his eye.
21.27:
Exo 21:27 If he knocks out the tooth of his slave, male or female, he shall let the slave go free because of his
tooth.
21.28:
Exo 21:28 "When an ox gores a man or a woman to death, the ox shall be stoned, and its flesh shall not be
eaten, but the owner of the ox shall not be liable.
21.29:
Exo 21:29 But if the ox has been accustomed to gore in the past, and its owner has been warned but has not
kept it in, and it kills a man or a woman, the ox shall be stoned, and its owner also shall be put to death.
21.30:
Exo 21:30 If a ransom is imposed on him, then he shall give for the redemption of his life whatever is imposed
on him.
21.31: Exo 21:31 If it gores a man's son or daughter, he shall be dealt with according to this same rule.
21.32:
Exo 21:32 If the ox gores a slave, male or female, the owner shall give to their master thirty shekels of silver,
and the ox shall be stoned.
21.33:
Exo 21:33 "When a man opens a pit, or when a man digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or a donkey falls
into it,
21.34:
Exo 21:34 the owner of the pit shall make restoration. He shall give money to its owner, and the dead beast
shall be his.
21.35:
Exo 21:35 "When one man's ox butts another's, so that it dies, then they shall sell the live ox and share its price,
and the dead beast also they shall share.
21.36:
Exo 21:36 Or if it is known that the ox has been accustomed to gore in the past, and its owner has not kept it in,
he shall repay ox for ox, and the dead beast shall be his.

22.1:
Exo 22:1 "If a man steals an ox or a sheep, and kills it or sells it, he shall repay five oxen for an ox, and four
sheep for a sheep.
22.2: Exo 22:2 "If a thief is found breaking in and is struck so that he dies, there shall be no bloodguilt for him,
22.3:
Exo 22:3 but if the sun has risen on him, there shall be bloodguilt for him. He shall surely pay. If he has nothing,
then he shall be sold for his theft.
22.4:
Exo 22:4 If the stolen beast is found alive in his possession, whether it is an ox or a donkey or a sheep, he shall
pay double.
22.5:
Exo 22:5 "If a man causes a field or vineyard to be grazed over, or lets his beast loose and it feeds in another
man's field, he shall make restitution from the best in his own field and in his own vineyard.
22.6:
Exo 22:6 "If fire breaks out and catches in thorns so that the stacked grain or the standing grain or the field is
consumed, he who started the fire shall make full restitution.
22.7:
Exo 22:7 "If a man gives to his neighbor money or goods to keep safe, and it is stolen from the man's house,
then, if the thief is found, he shall pay double.
22.8:
Exo 22:8 If the thief is not found, the owner of the house shall come near to God to show whether or not he has
put his hand to his neighbor's property.
22.9:
Exo 22:9 For every breach of trust, whether it is for an ox, for a donkey, for a sheep, for a cloak, or for any kind
of lost thing, of which one says, 'This is it,' the case of both parties shall come before God. The one whom God
condemns shall pay double to his neighbor.
22.10:
Exo 22:10 "If a man gives to his neighbor a donkey or an ox or a sheep or any beast to keep safe, and it dies or
is injured or is driven away, without anyone seeing it,
22.11:
Exo 22:11 an oath by the LORD shall be between them both to see whether or not he has put his hand to his
neighbor's property. The owner shall accept the oath, and he shall not make restitution.
22.12: Exo 22:12 But if it is stolen from him, he shall make restitution to its owner.
22.13:
Exo 22:13 If it is torn by beasts, let him bring it as evidence. He shall not make restitution for what has been
torn.
22.14:
Exo 22:14 "If a man borrows anything of his neighbor, and it is injured or dies, the owner not being with it, he
shall make full restitution.
22.15: Exo 22:15 If the owner was with it, he shall not make restitution; if it was hired, it came for its hiring fee.
22.16: Exo 22:16 "If a man seduces a virgin who is not engaged to be married and lies with her, he shall give the brideprice for her and make her his wife.
22.17: Exo 22:17 If her father utterly refuses to give her to him, he shall pay money equal to the bride-price for virgins.
22.18: Exo 22:18 "You shall not permit a sorceress to live.
22.19: Exo 22:19 "Whoever lies with an animal shall be put to death.
22.20: Exo 22:20 "Whoever sacrifices to any god, other than the LORD alone, shall be devoted to destruction.
22.21: Exo 22:21 "You shall not wrong a sojourner or oppress him, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
22.22: Exo 22:22 You shall not mistreat any widow or fatherless child.
22.23: Exo 22:23 If you do mistreat them, and they cry out to me, I will surely hear their cry,
22.24:
Exo 22:24 and my wrath will burn, and I will kill you with the sword, and your wives shall become widows and
your children fatherless.
22.25:
Exo 22:25 "If you lend money to any of my people with you who is poor, you shall not be like a moneylender to
him, and you shall not exact interest from him.
22.26: Exo 22:26 If ever you take your neighbor's cloak in pledge, you shall return it to him before the sun goes down,
22.27:
Exo 22:27 for that is his only covering, and it is his cloak for his body; in what else shall he sleep? And if he
cries to me, I will hear, for I am compassionate.
22.28: Exo 22:28 "You shall not revile God, nor curse a ruler of your people.
22.29:
Exo 22:29 "You shall not delay to offer from the fullness of your harvest and from the outflow of your presses.
The firstborn of your sons you shall give to me.
22.30:
Exo 22:30 You shall do the same with your oxen and with your sheep: seven days it shall be with its mother; on
the eighth day you shall give it to me.
22.31:
Exo 22:31 "You shall be consecrated to me. Therefore you shall not eat any flesh that is torn by beasts in the
field; you shall throw it to the dogs.

23.1:
Exo 23:1 "You shall not spread a false report. You shall not join hands with a wicked man to be a malicious
witness.
23.2:
Exo 23:2 You shall not fall in with the many to do evil, nor shall you bear witness in a lawsuit, siding with the
many, so as to pervert justice,
23.3: Exo 23:3 nor shall you be partial to a poor man in his lawsuit.
23.4: Exo 23:4 "If you meet your enemy's ox or his donkey going astray, you shall bring it back to him.
23.5:
Exo 23:5 If you see the donkey of one who hates you lying down under its burden, you shall refrain from leaving
him with it; you shall rescue it with him.
23.6: Exo 23:6 "You shall not pervert the justice due to your poor in his lawsuit.
23.7: Exo 23:7 Keep far from a false charge, and do not kill the innocent and righteous, for I will not acquit the wicked.
23.8:
Exo 23:8 And you shall take no bribe, for a bribe blinds the clear-sighted and subverts the cause of those who
are in the right.
23.9:
Exo 23:9 "You shall not oppress a sojourner. You know the heart of a sojourner, for you were sojourners in the
land of Egypt.
23.10: Exo 23:10 "For six years you shall sow your land and gather in its yield,
23.11:
Exo 23:11 but the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow, that the poor of your people may eat; and what
they leave the beasts of the field may eat. You shall do likewise with your vineyard, and with your olive orchard.
23.12:
Exo 23:12 "Six days you shall do your work, but on the seventh day you shall rest; that your ox and your donkey
may have rest, and the son of your servant woman, and the alien, may be refreshed.
23.13:
Exo 23:13 "Pay attention to all that I have said to you, and make no mention of the names of other gods, nor let
it be heard on your lips.
23.14: Exo 23:14 "Three times in the year you shall keep a feast to me.
23.15:
Exo 23:15 You shall keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread. As I commanded you, you shall eat unleavened
bread for seven days at the appointed time in the month of Abib, for in it you came out of Egypt. None shall
appear before me empty-handed.
23.16:
Exo 23:16 You shall keep the Feast of Harvest, of the firstfruits of your labor, of what you sow in the field. You
shall keep the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather in from the field the fruit of your labor.
23.17: Exo 23:17 Three times in the year shall all your males appear before the Lord GOD.
23.18:
Exo 23:18 "You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with anything leavened, or let the fat of my feast remain
until the morning.
23.19:
Exo 23:19 "The best of the firstfruits of your ground you shall bring into the house of the LORD your God. "You
shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk.
23.20:
Exo 23:20 "Behold, I send an angel before you to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place that I have
prepared.
23.21:
Exo 23:21 Pay careful attention to him and obey his voice; do not rebel against him, for he will not pardon your
transgression, for my name is in him.
23.22:
Exo 23:22 "But if you carefully obey his voice and do all that I say, then I will be an enemy to your enemies and
an adversary to your adversaries.
23.23:
Exo 23:23 "When my angel goes before you and brings you to the Amorites and the Hittites and the Perizzites
and the Canaanites, the Hivites and the Jebusites, and I blot them out,
23.24:
Exo 23:24 you shall not bow down to their gods nor serve them, nor do as they do, but you shall utterly
overthrow them and break their pillars in pieces.
23.25:
Exo 23:25 You shall serve the LORD your God, and he will bless your bread and your water, and I will take
sickness away from among you.
23.26: Exo 23:26 None shall miscarry or be barren in your land; I will fulfill the number of your days.
23.27:
Exo 23:27 I will send my terror before you and will throw into confusion all the people against whom you shall
come, and I will make all your enemies turn their backs to you.
23.28:
Exo 23:28 And I will send hornets before you, which shall drive out the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites
from before you.
23.29:
Exo 23:29 I will not drive them out from before you in one year, lest the land become desolate and the wild
beasts multiply against you.
23.30: Exo 23:30 Little by little I will drive them out from before you, until you have increased and possess the land.
23.31:
Exo 23:31 And I will set your border from the Red Sea to the Sea of the Philistines, and from the wilderness to
the Euphrates, for I will give the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and you shall drive them out before you.
23.32: Exo 23:32 You shall make no covenant with them and their gods.
23.33:
Exo 23:33 They shall not dwell in your land, lest they make you sin against me; for if you serve their gods, it will
surely be a snare to you."

24.1:
Exo 24:1 Then he said to Moses, "Come up to the LORD, you and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the
elders of Israel, and worship from afar.
24.2:
Exo 24:2 Moses alone shall come near to the LORD, but the others shall not come near, and the people shall
not come up with him."
24.3:
Exo 24:3 Moses came and told the people all the words of the LORD and all the rules. And all the people
answered with one voice and said, "All the words that the LORD has spoken we will do."
24.4:
Exo 24:4 And Moses wrote down all the words of the LORD. He rose early in the morning and built an altar at
the foot of the mountain, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
24.5:
Exo 24:5 And he sent young men of the people of Israel, who offered burnt offerings and sacrificed peace
offerings of oxen to the LORD.
24.6: Exo 24:6 And Moses took half of the blood and put it in basins, and half of the blood he threw against the altar.
24.7:
Exo 24:7 Then he took the Book of the Covenant and read it in the hearing of the people. And they said, "All
that the LORD has spoken we will do, and we will be obedient."
24.8:
Exo 24:8 And Moses took the blood and threw it on the people and said, "Behold the blood of the covenant that
the LORD has made with you in accordance with all these words."
24.9: Exo 24:9 Then Moses and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel went up,
24.10:
Exo 24:10 and they saw the God of Israel. There was under his feet as it were a pavement of sapphire stone,
like the very heaven for clearness.
24.11:
Exo 24:11 And he did not lay his hand on the chief men of the people of Israel; they beheld God, and ate and
drank.
24.12:
Exo 24:12 The LORD said to Moses, "Come up to me on the mountain and wait there, that I may give you the
tablets of stone, with the law and the commandment, which I have written for their instruction."
24.13: Exo 24:13 So Moses rose with his assistant Joshua, and Moses went up into the mountain of God.
24.14:
Exo 24:14 And he said to the elders, "Wait here for us until we return to you. And behold, Aaron and Hur are
with you. Whoever has a dispute, let him go to them."
24.15: Exo 24:15 Then Moses went up on the mountain, and the cloud covered the mountain.
24.16:
Exo 24:16 The glory of the LORD dwelt on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days. And on the seventh
day he called to Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
24.17:
Exo 24:17 Now the appearance of the glory of the LORD was like a devouring fire on the top of the mountain in
the sight of the people of Israel.
24.18:
Exo 24:18 Moses entered the cloud and went up on the mountain. And Moses was on the mountain forty days
and forty nights.

25.1: Exo 25:1 The LORD said to Moses,
25.2:
Exo 25:2 "Speak to the people of Israel, that they take for me a contribution. From every man whose heart
moves him you shall receive the contribution for me.
25.3: Exo 25:3 And this is the contribution that you shall receive from them: gold, silver, and bronze,
25.4: Exo 25:4 blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen, goats' hair,
25.5: Exo 25:5 tanned rams' skins, goatskins, acacia wood,
25.6: Exo 25:6 oil for the lamps, spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
25.7: Exo 25:7 onyx stones, and stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
25.8: Exo 25:8 And let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell in their midst.
25.9:
Exo 25:9 Exactly as I show you concerning the pattern of the tabernacle, and of all its furniture, so you shall
make it.
25.10:
Exo 25:10 "They shall make an ark of acacia wood. Two cubits and a half shall be its length, a cubit and a half
its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height.
25.11: Exo 25:11 You shall overlay it with pure gold, inside and outside shall you overlay it, and you shall make on it amolding of gold around it.
25.12:
Exo 25:12 You shall cast four rings of gold for it and put them on its four feet, two rings on the one side of it, and
two rings on the other side of it.
25.13: Exo 25:13 You shall make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
25.14: Exo 25:14 And you shall put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry the ark by them.
25.15: Exo 25:15 The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark; they shall not be taken from it.
25.16: Exo 25:16 And you shall put into the ark the testimony that I shall give you.
25.17:
Exo 25:17 "You shall make a mercy seat of pure gold. Two cubits and a half shall be its length, and a cubit and
a half its breadth.
25.18:
Exo 25:18 And you shall make two cherubim of gold; of hammered work shall you make them, on the two ends
of the mercy seat.
25.19:
Exo 25:19 Make one cherub on the one end, and one cherub on the other end. Of one piece with the mercy
seat shall you make the cherubim on its two ends.
25.20:
Exo 25:20 The cherubim shall spread out their wings above, overshadowing the mercy seat with their wings,
their faces one to another; toward the mercy seat shall the faces of the cherubim be.
25.21:
Exo 25:21 And you shall put the mercy seat on the top of the ark, and in the ark you shall put the testimony that
I shall give you.
25.22:
Exo 25:22 There I will meet with you, and from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubim that are
on the ark of the testimony, I will speak with you about all that I will give you in commandment for the people of
Israel.
25.23:
Exo 25:23 "You shall make a table of acacia wood. Two cubits shall be its length, a cubit its breadth, and a cubit
and a half its height.
25.24: Exo 25:24 You shall overlay it with pure gold and make a molding of gold around it.
25.25: Exo 25:25 And you shall make a rim around it a handbreadth wide, and a molding of gold around the rim.
25.26: Exo 25:26 And you shall make for it four rings of gold, and fasten the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
25.27: Exo 25:27 Close to the frame the rings shall lie, as holders for the poles to carry the table.
25.28:
Exo 25:28 You shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold, and the table shall be carried
with these.
25.29:
Exo 25:29 And you shall make its plates and dishes for incense, and its flagons and bowls with which to pour
drink offerings; you shall make them of pure gold.
25.30: Exo 25:30 And you shall set the bread of the Presence on the table before me regularly.
25.31:
Exo 25:31 "You shall make a lampstand of pure gold. The lampstand shall be made of hammered work: its
base, its stem, its cups, its calyxes, and its flowers shall be of one piece with it.
25.32:
Exo 25:32 And there shall be six branches going out of its sides, three branches of the lampstand out of one
side of it and three branches of the lampstand out of the other side of it;
25.33:
Exo 25:33 three cups made like almond blossoms, each with calyx and flower, on one branch, and three cups
made like almond blossoms, each with calyx and flower, on the other branch- so for the six branches going out
of the lampstand.
25.34:
Exo 25:34 And on the lampstand itself there shall be four cups made like almond blossoms, with their calyxes
and flowers,
25.35: Exo 25:35 and a calyx of one piece with it under each pair of the six branches going out from the lampstand.
25.36:
Exo 25:36 Their calyxes and their branches shall be of one piece with it, the whole of it a single piece of
hammered work of pure gold.
25.37:
Exo 25:37 You shall make seven lamps for it. And the lamps shall be set up so as to give light on the space in
front of it.
25.38: Exo 25:38 Its tongs and their trays shall be of pure gold.
25.39: Exo 25:39 It shall be made, with all these utensils, out of a talent of pure gold.
25.40: Exo 25:40 And see that you make them after the pattern for them, which is being shown you on the mountain.

26.1:
Exo 26:1 "Moreover, you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen and blue and purple
and scarlet yarns; you shall make them with cherubim skillfully worked into them.
26.2:
Exo 26:2 The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits; all
the curtains shall be the same size.
26.3:
Exo 26:3 Five curtains shall be coupled to one another, and the other five curtains shall be coupled to one
another.
26.4:
Exo 26:4 And you shall make loops of blue on the edge of the outermost curtain in the first set. Likewise you
shall make loops on the edge of the outermost curtain in the second set.
26.5:
Exo 26:5 Fifty loops you shall make on the one curtain, and fifty loops you shall make on the edge of the curtain
that is in the second set; the loops shall be opposite one another.
26.6: Exo 26:6 And you shall make fifty clasps of gold, and couple the curtains one to the other with the clasps, sothat the tabernacle may be a single whole.
26.7:
Exo 26:7 "You shall also make curtains of goats' hair for a tent over the tabernacle; eleven curtains shall you
make.
26.8:
Exo 26:8 The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. The
eleven curtains shall be the same size.
26.9:
Exo 26:9 You shall couple five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and the sixth curtain you
shall double over at the front of the tent.
26.10:
Exo 26:10 You shall make fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in one set, and fifty loops on
the edge of the curtain that is outermost in the second set.
26.11:
Exo 26:11 "You shall make fifty clasps of bronze, and put the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together
that it may be a single whole.
26.12:
Exo 26:12 And the part that remains of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remains, shall hang over the
back of the tabernacle.
26.13:
Exo 26:13 And the extra that remains in the length of the curtains, the cubit on the one side, and the cubit on the
other side, shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle, on this side and that side, to cover it.
26.14: Exo 26:14 And you shall make for the tent a covering of tanned rams' skins and a covering of goatskins on top.
26.15: Exo 26:15 "You shall make upright frames for the tabernacle of acacia wood.
26.16: Exo 26:16 Ten cubits shall be the length of a frame, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each frame.
26.17:
Exo 26:17 There shall be two tenons in each frame, for fitting together. So shall you do for all the frames of the
tabernacle.
26.18: Exo 26:18 You shall make the frames for the tabernacle: twenty frames for the south side;
26.19:
Exo 26:19 and forty bases of silver you shall make under the twenty frames, two bases under one frame for its
two tenons, and two bases under the next frame for its two tenons;
26.20: Exo 26:20 and for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side twenty frames,
26.21: Exo 26:21 and their forty bases of silver, two bases under one frame, and two bases under the next frame.
26.22: Exo 26:22 And for the rear of the tabernacle westward you shall make six frames.
26.23: Exo 26:23 And you shall make two frames for corners of the tabernacle in the rear;
26.24:
Exo 26:24 they shall be separate beneath, but joined at the top, at the first ring. Thus shall it be with both of
them; they shall form the two corners.
26.25:
Exo 26:25 And there shall be eight frames, with their bases of silver, sixteen bases; two bases under one frame,
and two bases under another frame.
26.26: Exo 26:26 "You shall make bars of acacia wood, five for the frames of the one side of the tabernacle,
26.27:
Exo 26:27 and five bars for the frames of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the frames of the
side of the tabernacle at the rear westward.
26.28: Exo 26:28 The middle bar, halfway up the frames, shall run from end to end.
26.29:
Exo 26:29 You shall overlay the frames with gold and shall make their rings of gold for holders for the bars, and
you shall overlay the bars with gold.
26.30: Exo 26:30 Then you shall erect the tabernacle according to the plan for it that you were shown on the mountain.
26.31:
Exo 26:31 "And you shall make a veil of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen. It shall be
made with cherubim skillfully worked into it.
26.32:
Exo 26:32 And you shall hang it on four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold, with hooks of gold, on four bases of
silver.
26.33:
Exo 26:33 And you shall hang the veil from the clasps, and bring the ark of the testimony in there within the veil.
And the veil shall separate for you the Holy Place from the Most Holy.
26.34: Exo 26:34 You shall put the mercy seat on the ark of the testimony in the Most Holy Place.
26.35:
Exo 26:35 And you shall set the table outside the veil, and the lampstand on the south side of the tabernacle
opposite the table, and you shall put the table on the north side.
26.36:
Exo 26:36 "You shall make a screen for the entrance of the tent, of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine
twined linen, embroidered with needlework.
26.37:
Exo 26:37 And you shall make for the screen five pillars of acacia, and overlay them with gold. Their hooks shall
be of gold, and you shall cast five bases of bronze for them.

27.1:
Exo 27:1 "You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits broad. The altar shall be
square, and its height shall be three cubits.
27.2:
Exo 27:2 And you shall make horns for it on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it, and you shall
overlay it with bronze.
27.3:
Exo 27:3 You shall make pots for it to receive its ashes, and shovels and basins and forks and fire pans. You
shall make all its utensils of bronze.
27.4:
Exo 27:4 You shall also make for it a grating, a network of bronze, and on the net you shall make four bronze
rings at its four corners.
27.5: Exo 27:5 And you shall set it under the ledge of the altar so that the net extends halfway down the altar.
27.6: Exo 27:6 And you shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze.
27.7:
Exo 27:7 And the poles shall be put through the rings, so that the poles are on the two sides of the altar when it
is carried.
27.8: Exo 27:8 You shall make it hollow, with boards. As it has been shown you on the mountain, so shall it be made.
27.9:
Exo 27:9 "You shall make the court of the tabernacle. On the south side the court shall have hangings of fine
twined linen a hundred cubits long for one side.
27.10:
Exo 27:10 Its twenty pillars and their twenty bases shall be of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their fillets
shall be of silver.
27.11:
Exo 27:11 And likewise for its length on the north side there shall be hangings a hundred cubits long, its pillars
twenty and their bases twenty, of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.
27.12:
Exo 27:12 And for the breadth of the court on the west side there shall be hangings for fifty cubits, with ten
pillars and ten bases.
27.13: Exo 27:13 The breadth of the court on the front to the east shall be fifty cubits.
27.14:
Exo 27:14 The hangings for the one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and three
bases.
27.15: Exo 27:15 On the other side the hangings shall be fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and three bases.
27.16:
Exo 27:16 For the gate of the court there shall be a screen twenty cubits long, of blue and purple and scarlet
yarns and fine twined linen, embroidered with needlework. It shall have four pillars and with them four bases.
27.17:
Exo 27:17 All the pillars around the court shall be filleted with silver. Their hooks shall be of silver, and their
bases of bronze.
27.18:
Exo 27:18 The length of the court shall be a hundred cubits, the breadth fifty, and the height five cubits, with
hangings of fine twined linen and bases of bronze.
27.19:
Exo 27:19 All the utensils of the tabernacle for every use, and all its pegs and all the pegs of the court, shall be
of bronze.
27.20:
Exo 27:20 "You shall command the people of Israel that they bring to you pure beaten olive oil for the light, that
a lamp may regularly be set up to burn.
27.21:
Exo 27:21 In the tent of meeting, outside the veil that is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall tend it
from evening to morning before the LORD. It shall be a statute forever to be observed throughout their
generations by the people of Israel.

28.1:
Exo 28:1 "Then bring near to you Aaron your brother, and his sons with him, from among the people of Israel, to
serve me as priests- Aaron and Aaron's sons, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
28.2: Exo 28:2 And you shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, for glory and for beauty.
28.3:
Exo 28:3 You shall speak to all the skillful, whom I have filled with a spirit of skill, that they make Aaron's
garments to consecrate him for my priesthood.
28.4:
Exo 28:4 These are the garments that they shall make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a coat of checker work,
a turban, and a sash. They shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother and his sons to serve me as priests.
28.5: Exo 28:5 They shall receive gold, blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen.
28.6:
Exo 28:6 "And they shall make the ephod of gold, of blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and of fine twined linen,
skillfully worked.
28.7: Exo 28:7 It shall have two shoulder pieces attached to its two edges, so that it may be joined together.
28.8:
Exo 28:8 And the skillfully woven band on it shall be made like it and be of one piece with it, of gold, blue and
purple and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen.
28.9: Exo 28:9 You shall take two onyx stones, and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel,
28.10:
Exo 28:10 six of their names on the one stone, and the names of the remaining six on the other stone, in the
order of their birth.
28.11:
Exo 28:11 As a jeweler engraves signets, so shall you engrave the two stones with the names of the sons of
Israel. You shall enclose them in settings of gold filigree.
28.12:
Exo 28:12 And you shall set the two stones on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, as stones of remembrance for
the sons of Israel. And Aaron shall bear their names before the LORD on his two shoulders for remembrance.
28.13: Exo 28:13 You shall make settings of gold filigree,
28.14: Exo 28:14 and two chains of pure gold, twisted like cords; and you shall attach the corded chains to the settings.
28.15:
Exo 28:15 "You shall make a breastpiece of judgment, in skilled work. In the style of the ephod you shall make
it- of gold, blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen shall you make it.
28.16: Exo 28:16 It shall be square and doubled, a span its length and a span its breadth.
28.17: Exo 28:17 You shall set in it four rows of stones. A row of sardius, topaz, and carbuncle shall be the first row;
28.18: Exo 28:18 and the second row an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond;
28.19: Exo 28:19 and the third row a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
28.20: Exo 28:20 and the fourth row a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. They shall be set in gold filigree.
28.21:
Exo 28:21 There shall be twelve stones with their names according to the names of the sons of Israel. They
shall be like signets, each engraved with its name, for the twelve tribes.
28.22: Exo 28:22 You shall make for the breastpiece twisted chains like cords, of pure gold.
28.23:
Exo 28:23 And you shall make for the breastpiece two rings of gold, and put the two rings on the two edges of
the breastpiece.
28.24: Exo 28:24 And you shall put the two cords of gold in the two rings at the edges of the breastpiece.
28.25:
Exo 28:25 The two ends of the two cords you shall attach to the two settings of filigree, and so attach it in front
to the shoulder pieces of the ephod.
28.26:
Exo 28:26 You shall make two rings of gold, and put them at the two ends of the breastpiece, on its inside edge
next to the ephod.
28.27:
Exo 28:27 And you shall make two rings of gold, and attach them in front to the lower part of the two shoulder
pieces of the ephod, at its seam above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
28.28:
Exo 28:28 And they shall bind the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, so that it
may lie on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, so that the breastpiece shall not come loose from the ephod.
28.29:
Exo 28:29 So Aaron shall bear the names of the sons of Israel in the breastpiece of judgment on his heart,
when he goes into the Holy Place, to bring them to regular remembrance before the LORD.
28.30:
Exo 28:30 And in the breastpiece of judgment you shall put the Urim and the Thummim, and they shall be on
Aaron's heart, when he goes in before the LORD. Thus Aaron shall bear the judgment of the people of Israel on
his heart before the LORD regularly.
28.31: Exo 28:31 "You shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
28.32:
Exo 28:32 It shall have an opening for the head in the middle of it, with a woven binding around the opening, like
the opening in a garment, so that it may not tear.
28.33:
Exo 28:33 On its hem you shall make pomegranates of blue and purple and scarlet yarns, around its hem, with
bells of gold between them,
28.34: Exo 28:34 a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, around the hem of the robe.
28.35:
Exo 28:35 And it shall be on Aaron when he ministers, and its sound shall be heard when he goes into the Holy
Place before the LORD, and when he comes out, so that he does not die.
28.36:
Exo 28:36 "You shall make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it, like the engraving of a signet, 'Holy to the
LORD.'
28.37: Exo 28:37 And you shall fasten it on the turban by a cord of blue. It shall be on the front of the turban.
28.38:
Exo 28:38 It shall be on Aaron's forehead, and Aaron shall bear any guilt from the holy things that the people of
Israel consecrate as their holy gifts. It shall regularly be on his forehead, that they may be accepted before the
LORD.
28.39:
Exo 28:39 "You shall weave the coat in checker work of fine linen, and you shall make a turban of fine linen,
and you shall make a sash embroidered with needlework.
28.40:
Exo 28:40 "For Aaron's sons you shall make coats and sashes and caps. You shall make them for glory and
beauty.
28.41:
Exo 28:41 And you shall put them on Aaron your brother, and on his sons with him, and shall anoint them and
ordain them and consecrate them, that they may serve me as priests.
28.42:
Exo 28:42 You shall make for them linen undergarments to cover their naked flesh. They shall reach from the
hips to the thighs;
28.43:
Exo 28:43 and they shall be on Aaron and on his sons when they go into the tent of meeting or when they come
near the altar to minister in the Holy Place, lest they bear guilt and die. This shall be a statute forever for him and
for his offspring after him.

29.1:
Exo 29:1 "Now this is what you shall do to them to consecrate them, that they may serve me as priests. Take
one bull of the herd and two rams without blemish,
29.2:
Exo 29:2 and unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers smeared with oil.
You shall make them of fine wheat flour.
29.3: Exo 29:3 You shall put them in one basket and bring them in the basket, and bring the bull and the two rams.
29.4: Exo 29:4 You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
29.5:
Exo 29:5 Then you shall take the garments, and put on Aaron the coat and the robe of the ephod, and the
ephod, and the breastpiece, and gird him with the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
29.6: Exo 29:6 And you shall set the turban on his head and put the holy crown on the turban.
29.7: Exo 29:7 You shall take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.
29.8: Exo 29:8 Then you shall bring his sons and put coats on them,
29.9:
Exo 29:9 and you shall gird Aaron and his sons with sashes and bind caps on them. And the priesthood shall be
theirs by a statute forever. Thus you shall ordain Aaron and his sons.
29.10:
Exo 29:10 "Then you shall bring the bull before the tent of meeting. Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on
the head of the bull.
29.11: Exo 29:11 Then you shall kill the bull before the LORD at the entrance of the tent of meeting,
29.12:
Exo 29:12 and shall take part of the blood of the bull and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, and the
rest of the blood you shall pour out at the base of the altar.
29.13:
Exo 29:13 And you shall take all the fat that covers the entrails, and the long lobe of the liver, and the two
kidneys with the fat that is on them, and burn them on the altar.
29.14:
Exo 29:14 But the flesh of the bull and its skin and its dung you shall burn with fire outside the camp; it is a sin
offering.
29.15:
Exo 29:15 "Then you shall take one of the rams, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the
ram,
29.16: Exo 29:16 and you shall kill the ram and shall take its blood and throw it against the sides of the altar.
29.17:
Exo 29:17 Then you shall cut the ram into pieces, and wash its entrails and its legs, and put them with its pieces
and its head,
29.18:
Exo 29:18 and burn the whole ram on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the LORD. It is a pleasing aroma, a food
offering to the LORD.
29.19: Exo 29:19 "You shall take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram,
29.20:
Exo 29:20 and you shall kill the ram and take part of its blood and put it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron and
on the tips of the right ears of his sons, and on the thumbs of their right hands and on the great toes of their right
feet, and throw the rest of the blood against the sides of the altar.
29.21:
Exo 29:21 Then you shall take part of the blood that is on the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on
Aaron and his garments, and on his sons and his sons' garments with him. He and his garments shall be holy,
and his sons and his sons' garments with him.
29.22:
Exo 29:22 "You shall also take the fat from the ram and the fat tail and the fat that covers the entrails, and the
long lobe of the liver and the two kidneys with the fat that is on them, and the right thigh (for it is a ram of
ordination),
29.23:
Exo 29:23 and one loaf of bread and one cake of bread made with oil, and one wafer out of the basket of
unleavened bread that is before the LORD.
29.24:
Exo 29:24 You shall put all these on the palms of Aaron and on the palms of his sons, and wave them for a
wave offering before the LORD.
29.25:
Exo 29:25 Then you shall take them from their hands and burn them on the altar on top of the burnt offering, as
a pleasing aroma before the LORD. It is a food offering to the LORD.
29.26:
Exo 29:26 "You shall take the breast of the ram of Aaron's ordination and wave it for a wave offering before the
LORD, and it shall be your portion.
29.27:
Exo 29:27 And you shall consecrate the breast of the wave offering that is waved and the thigh of the priests'
portion that is contributed from the ram of ordination, from what was Aaron's and his sons.
29.28:
Exo 29:28 It shall be for Aaron and his sons as a perpetual due from the people of Israel, for it is a contribution.
It shall be a contribution from the people of Israel from their peace offerings, their contribution to the LORD.
29.29:
Exo 29:29 "The holy garments of Aaron shall be for his sons after him; they shall be anointed in them and
ordained in them.
29.30:
Exo 29:30 The son who succeeds him as priest, who comes into the tent of meeting to minister in the Holy
Place, shall wear them seven days.
29.31: Exo 29:31 "You shall take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in a holy place.
29.32:
Exo 29:32 And Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram and the bread that is in the basket in the
entrance of the tent of meeting.
29.33:
Exo 29:33 They shall eat those things with which atonement was made at their ordination and consecration, but
an outsider shall not eat of them, because they are holy.
29.34:
Exo 29:34 And if any of the flesh for the ordination or of the bread remain until the morning, then you shall burn
the remainder with fire. It shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
29.35:
Exo 29:35 "Thus you shall do to Aaron and to his sons, according to all that I have commanded you. Through
seven days shall you ordain them,
29.36:
Exo 29:36 and every day you shall offer a bull as a sin offering for atonement. Also you shall purify the altar,
when you make atonement for it, and shall anoint it to consecrate it.
29.37:
Exo 29:37 Seven days you shall make atonement for the altar and consecrate it, and the altar shall be most
holy. Whatever touches the altar shall become holy.
29.38: Exo 29:38 "Now this is what you shall offer on the altar: two lambs a year old day by day regularly.
29.39: Exo 29:39 One lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight.
29.40:
Exo 29:40 And with the first lamb a tenth seah of fine flour mingled with a fourth of a hin of beaten oil, and a
fourth of a hin of wine for a drink offering.
29.41:
Exo 29:41 The other lamb you shall offer at twilight, and shall offer with it a grain offering and its drink offering,
as in the morning, for a pleasing aroma, a food offering to the LORD.
29.42:
Exo 29:42 It shall be a regular burnt offering throughout your generations at the entrance of the tent of meeting
before the LORD, where I will meet with you, to speak to you there.
29.43: Exo 29:43 There I will meet with the people of Israel, and it shall be sanctified by my glory.
29.44:
Exo 29:44 I will consecrate the tent of meeting and the altar. Aaron also and his sons I will consecrate to serve
me as priests.
29.45: Exo 29:45 I will dwell among the people of Israel and will be their God.
29.46:
Exo 29:46 And they shall know that I am the LORD their God, who brought them out of the land of Egypt that I
might dwell among them. I am the LORD their God.

30.1: Exo 30:1 "You shall make an altar on which to burn incense; you shall make it of acacia wood.
30.2:
Exo 30:2 A cubit shall be its length, and a cubit its breadth. It shall be square, and two cubits shall be its height.
Its horns shall be of one piece with it.
30.3:
Exo 30:3 You shall overlay it with pure gold, its top and around its sides and its horns. And you shall make a
molding of gold around it.
30.4:
Exo 30:4 And you shall make two golden rings for it. Under its molding on two opposite sides of it you shall
make them, and they shall be holders for poles with which to carry it.
30.5: Exo 30:5 You shall make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
30.6:
Exo 30:6 And you shall put it in front of the veil that is above the ark of the testimony, in front of the mercy seat
that is above the testimony, where I will meet with you.
30.7:
Exo 30:7 And Aaron shall burn fragrant incense on it. Every morning when he dresses the lamps he shall burn
it,
30.8:
Exo 30:8 and when Aaron sets up the lamps at twilight, he shall burn it, a regular incense offering before the
LORD throughout your generations.
30.9:
Exo 30:9 You shall not offer unauthorized incense on it, or a burnt offering, or a grain offering, and you shall not
pour a drink offering on it.
30.10:
Exo 30:10 Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once a year. With the blood of the sin offering of atonement
he shall make atonement for it once in the year throughout your generations. It is most holy to the LORD."
30.11: Exo 30:11 The LORD said to Moses,
30.12:
Exo 30:12 "When you take the census of the people of Israel, then each shall give a ransom for his life to the
LORD when you number them, that there be no plague among them when you number them.
30.13:
Exo 30:13 Each one who is numbered in the census shall give this: half a shekel according to the shekel of the
sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs), half a shekel as an offering to the LORD.
30.14:
Exo 30:14 Everyone who is numbered in the census, from twenty years old and upward, shall give the LORD's
offering.
30.15:
Exo 30:15 The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less, than the half shekel, when you give the
LORD's offering to make atonement for your lives.
30.16:
Exo 30:16 You shall take the atonement money from the people of Israel and shall give it for the service of the
tent of meeting, that it may bring the people of Israel to remembrance before the LORD, so as to make
atonement for your lives."
30.17: Exo 30:17 The LORD said to Moses,
30.18:
Exo 30:18 "You shall also make a basin of bronze, with its stand of bronze, for washing. You shall put it
between the tent of meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it,
30.19: Exo 30:19 with which Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet.
30.20:
Exo 30:20 When they go into the tent of meeting, or when they come near the altar to minister, to burn a food
offering to the LORD, they shall wash with water, so that they may not die.
30.21:
Exo 30:21 They shall wash their hands and their feet, so that they may not die. It shall be a statute forever to
them, even to him and to his offspring throughout their generations."
30.22: Exo 30:22 The LORD said to Moses,
30.23:
Exo 30:23 "Take the finest spices: of liquid myrrh 500 shekels, and of sweet-smelling cinnamon half as much,
that is, 250, and 250 of aromatic cane,
30.24: Exo 30:24 and 500 of cassia, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, and a hin of olive oil.
30.25:
Exo 30:25 And you shall make of these a sacred anointing oil blended as by the perfumer; it shall be a holy
anointing oil.
30.26: Exo 30:26 With it you shall anoint the tent of meeting and the ark of the testimony,
30.27: Exo 30:27 and the table and all its utensils, and the lampstand and its utensils, and the altar of incense,
30.28: Exo 30:28 and the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils and the basin and its stand.
30.29: Exo 30:29 You shall consecrate them, that they may be most holy. Whatever touches them will become holy.
30.30: Exo 30:30 You shall anoint Aaron and his sons, and consecrate them, that they may serve me as priests.
30.31:
Exo 30:31 And you shall say to the people of Israel, 'This shall be my holy anointing oil throughout your
generations.
30.32:
Exo 30:32 It shall not be poured on the body of an ordinary person, and you shall make no other like it in
composition. It is holy, and it shall be holy to you.
30.33:
Exo 30:33 Whoever compounds any like it or whoever puts any of it on an outsider shall be cut off from his
people.'"
30.34:
Exo 30:34 The LORD said to Moses, "Take sweet spices, stacte, and onycha, and galbanum, sweet spices with
pure frankincense (of each shall there be an equal part),
30.35: Exo 30:35 and make an incense blended as by the perfumer, seasoned with salt, pure and holy.
30.36:
Exo 30:36 You shall beat some of it very small, and put part of it before the testimony in the tent of meeting
where I shall meet with you. It shall be most holy for you.
30.37:
Exo 30:37 And the incense that you shall make according to its composition, you shall not make for yourselves.
It shall be for you holy to the LORD.
30.38: Exo 30:38 Whoever makes any like it to use as perfume shall be cut off from his people."

31.1: Exo 31:1 The LORD said to Moses,
31.2: Exo 31:2 "See, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
31.3:
Exo 31:3 and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with ability and intelligence, with knowledge and all
craftsmanship,
31.4: Exo 31:4 to devise artistic designs, to work in gold, silver, and bronze,
31.5: Exo 31:5 in cutting stones for setting, and in carving wood, to work in every craft.
31.6:
Exo 31:6 And behold, I have appointed with him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan. And I have
given to all able men ability, that they may make all that I have commanded you:
31.7:
Exo 31:7 the tent of meeting, and the ark of the testimony, and the mercy seat that is on it, and all the
furnishings of the tent,
31.8: Exo 31:8 the table and its utensils, and the pure lampstand with all its utensils, and the altar of incense,
31.9: Exo 31:9 and the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin and its stand,
31.10:
Exo 31:10 and the finely worked garments, the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons,
for their service as priests,
31.11:
Exo 31:11 and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense for the Holy Place. According to all that I have
commanded you, they shall do."
31.12: Exo 31:12 And the LORD said to Moses,
31.13:
Exo 31:13 "You are to speak to the people of Israel and say, 'Above all you shall keep my Sabbaths, for this is a
sign between me and you throughout your generations, that you may know that I, the LORD, sanctify you.
31.14:
Exo 31:14 You shall keep the Sabbath, because it is holy for you. Everyone who profanes it shall be put to
death. Whoever does any work on it, that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
31.15:
Exo 31:15 Six days shall work be done, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of solemn rest, holy to the LORD.
Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day shall be put to death.
31.16:
Exo 31:16 Therefore the people of Israel shall keep the Sabbath, observing the Sabbath throughout their
generations, as a covenant forever.
31.17:
Exo 31:17 It is a sign forever between me and the people of Israel that in six days the LORD made heaven and
earth, and on the seventh day he rested and was refreshed.'"
31.18:
Exo 31:18 And he gave to Moses, when he had finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, the two tablets of
the testimony, tablets of stone, written with the finger of God.

32.1:
Exo 32:1 When the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mountain, the people gathered
themselves together to Aaron and said to him, "Up, make us gods who shall go before us. As for this Moses, the
man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him."
32.2:
Exo 32:2 So Aaron said to them, "Take off the rings of gold that are in the ears of your wives, your sons, and
your daughters, and bring them to me."
32.3: Exo 32:3 So all the people took off the rings of gold that were in their ears and brought them to Aaron.
32.4:
Exo 32:4 And he received the gold from their hand and fashioned it with a graving tool and made a golden calf.
And they said, "These are your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt!"
32.5:
Exo 32:5 When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it. And Aaron made proclamation and said, "Tomorrow
shall be a feast to the LORD."
32.6:
Exo 32:6 And they rose up early the next day and offered burnt offerings and brought peace offerings. And the
people sat down to eat and drink and rose up to play.
32.7:
Exo 32:7 And the LORD said to Moses, "Go down, for your people, whom you brought up out of the land of
Egypt, have corrupted themselves.
32.8:
Exo 32:8 They have turned aside quickly out of the way that I commanded them. They have made for
themselves a golden calf and have worshiped it and sacrificed to it and said, 'These are your gods, O Israel, who
brought you up out of the land of Egypt!'"
32.9: Exo 32:9 And the LORD said to Moses, "I have seen this people, and behold, it is a stiff-necked people.
32.10:
Exo 32:10 Now therefore let me alone, that my wrath may burn hot against them and I may consume them, in
order that I may make a great nation of you."
32.11:
Exo 32:11 But Moses implored the LORD his God and said, "O LORD, why does your wrath burn hot against
your people, whom you have brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?
32.12:
Exo 32:12 Why should the Egyptians say, 'With evil intent did he bring them out, to kill them in the mountains
and to consume them from the face of the earth'? Turn from your burning anger and relent from this disaster
against your people.
32.13:
Exo 32:13 Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants, to whom you swore by your own self, and said
to them, 'I will multiply your offspring as the stars of heaven, and all this land that I have promised I will give to
your offspring, and they shall inherit it forever.'"
32.14: Exo 32:14 And the LORD relented from the disaster that he had spoken of bringing on his people.
32.15:
Exo 32:15 Then Moses turned and went down from the mountain with the two tablets of the testimony in his
hand, tablets that were written on both sides; on the front and on the back they were written.
32.16: Exo 32:16 The tablets were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, engraved on the tablets.
32.17:
Exo 32:17 When Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, "There is a noise of
war in the camp."
32.18:
Exo 32:18 But he said, "It is not the sound of shouting for victory, or the sound of the cry of defeat, but the
sound of singing that I hear."
32.19:
Exo 32:19 And as soon as he came near the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, Moses' anger burned hot,
and he threw the tablets out of his hands and broke them at the foot of the mountain.
32.20:
Exo 32:20 He took the calf that they had made and burned it with fire and ground it to powder and scattered it
on the water and made the people of Israel drink it.
32.21:
Exo 32:21 And Moses said to Aaron, "What did this people do to you that you have brought such a great sin
upon them?"
32.22:
Exo 32:22 And Aaron said, "Let not the anger of my lord burn hot. You know the people, that they are set on
evil.
32.23:
Exo 32:23 For they said to me, 'Make us gods who shall go before us. As for this Moses, the man who brought
us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.'
32.24:
Exo 32:24 So I said to them, 'Let any who have gold take it off.' So they gave it to me, and I threw it into the fire,
and out came this calf."
32.25:
Exo 32:25 And when Moses saw that the people had broken loose (for Aaron had let them break loose, to the
derision of their enemies),
32.26:
Exo 32:26 then Moses stood in the gate of the camp and said, "Who is on the LORD's side? Come to me." And
all the sons of Levi gathered around him.
32.27:
Exo 32:27 And he said to them, "Thus says the LORD God of Israel, 'Put your sword on your side each of you,
and go to and fro from gate to gate throughout the camp, and each of you kill his brother and his companion and
his neighbor.'"
32.28:
Exo 32:28 And the sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses. And that day about three thousand men of
the people fell.
32.29:
Exo 32:29 And Moses said, "Today you have been ordained for the service of the LORD, each one at the cost
of his son and of his brother, so that he might bestow a blessing upon you this day."
32.30:
Exo 32:30 The next day Moses said to the people, "You have sinned a great sin. And now I will go up to the
LORD; perhaps I can make atonement for your sin."
32.31:
Exo 32:31 So Moses returned to the LORD and said, "Alas, this people have sinned a great sin. They have
made for themselves gods of gold.
32.32: Exo 32:32 But now, if you will forgive their sin- but if not, please blot me out of your book that you have written."
32.33: Exo 32:33 But the LORD said to Moses, "Whoever has sinned against me, I will blot out of my book.
32.34:
Exo 32:34 But now go, lead the people to the place about which I have spoken to you; behold, my angel shall
go before you. Nevertheless, in the day when I visit, I will visit their sin upon them."
32.35: Exo 32:35 Then the LORD sent a plague on the people, because they made the calf, the one that Aaron made.

33.1:
Exo 33:1 The LORD said to Moses, "Depart; go up from here, you and the people whom you have brought up
out of the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, 'To your offspring I
will give it.'
33.2:
Exo 33:2 I will send an angel before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the
Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
33.3:
Exo 33:3 Go up to a land flowing with milk and honey; but I will not go up among you, lest I consume you on the
way, for you are a stiff-necked people."
33.4: Exo 33:4 When the people heard this disastrous word, they mourned, and no one put on his ornaments.
33.5:
Exo 33:5 For the LORD had said to Moses, "Say to the people of Israel, 'You are a stiff-necked people; if for asingle moment I should go up among you, I would consume you. So now take off your ornaments, that I may
know what to do with you.'"
33.6: Exo 33:6 Therefore the people of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments, from Mount Horeb onward.
33.7:
Exo 33:7 Now Moses used to take the tent and pitch it outside the camp, far off from the camp, and he called it
the tent of meeting. And everyone who sought the LORD would go out to the tent of meeting, which was outside
the camp.
33.8:
Exo 33:8 Whenever Moses went out to the tent, all the people would rise up, and each would stand at his tent
door, and watch Moses until he had gone into the tent.
33.9:
Exo 33:9 When Moses entered the tent, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the tent,
and the LORD would speak with Moses.
33.10:
Exo 33:10 And when all the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the entrance of the tent, all the people
would rise up and worship, each at his tent door.
33.11:
Exo 33:11 Thus the LORD used to speak to Moses face to face, as a man speaks to his friend. When Moses
turned again into the camp, his assistant Joshua the son of Nun, a young man, would not depart from the tent.
33.12:
Exo 33:12 Moses said to the LORD, "See, you say to me, 'Bring up this people,' but you have not let me know
whom you will send with me. Yet you have said, 'I know you by name, and you have also found favor in my
sight.'
33.13:
Exo 33:13 Now therefore, if I have found favor in your sight, please show me now your ways, that I may know
you in order to find favor in your sight. Consider too that this nation is your people."
33.14: Exo 33:14 And he said, "My presence will go with you, and I will give you rest."
33.15: Exo 33:15 And he said to him, "If your presence will not go with me, do not bring us up from here.
33.16:
Exo 33:16 For how shall it be known that I have found favor in your sight, I and your people? Is it not in your
going with us, so that we are distinct, I and your people, from every other people on the face of the earth?"
33.17:
Exo 33:17 And the LORD said to Moses, "This very thing that you have spoken I will do, for you have found
favor in my sight, and I know you by name."
33.18: Exo 33:18 Moses said, "Please show me your glory."
33.19:
Exo 33:19 And he said, "I will make all my goodness pass before you and will proclaim before you my name
'The LORD.' And I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will show mercy on whom I will show mercy.
33.20: Exo 33:20 But," he said, "you cannot see my face, for man shall not see me and live."
33.21: Exo 33:21 And the LORD said, "Behold, there is a place by me where you shall stand on the rock,
33.22:
Exo 33:22 and while my glory passes by I will put you in a cleft of the rock, and I will cover you with my hand
until I have passed by.
33.23: Exo 33:23 Then I will take away my hand, and you shall see my back, but my face shall not be seen."

34.1:
Exo 34:1 The LORD said to Moses, "Cut for yourself two tablets of stone like the first, and I will write on the
tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.
34.2:
Exo 34:2 Be ready by the morning, and come up in the morning to Mount Sinai, and present yourself there to
me on the top of the mountain.
34.3:
Exo 34:3 No one shall come up with you, and let no one be seen throughout all the mountain. Let no flocks or
herds graze opposite that mountain."
34.4:
Exo 34:4 So Moses cut two tablets of stone like the first. And he rose early in the morning and went up on
Mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him, and took in his hand two tablets of stone.
34.5: Exo 34:5 The LORD descended in the cloud and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of the LORD.
34.6:
Exo 34:6 The LORD passed before him and proclaimed, "The LORD, the LORD, a God merciful and gracious,
slow to anger, and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness,
34.7:
Exo 34:7 keeping steadfast love for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, but who will by no
means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children and the children's children, to the third
and the fourth generation."
34.8: Exo 34:8 And Moses quickly bowed his head toward the earth and worshiped.
34.9:
Exo 34:9 And he said, "If now I have found favor in your sight, O Lord, please let the Lord go in the midst of us,
for it is a stiff-necked people, and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for your inheritance."
34.10:
Exo 34:10 And he said, "Behold, I am making a covenant. Before all your people I will do marvels, such as have
not been created in all the earth or in any nation. And all the people among whom you are shall see the work of
the LORD, for it is an awesome thing that I will do with you.
34.11:
Exo 34:11 "Observe what I command you this day. Behold, I will drive out before you the Amorites, the
Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
34.12:
Exo 34:12 Take care, lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land to which you go, lest it become
a snare in your midst.
34.13: Exo 34:13 You shall tear down their altars and break their pillars and cut down their Asherim
34.14: Exo 34:14 (for you shall worship no other god, for the LORD, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God),
34.15:
Exo 34:15 lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and when they whore after their gods and
sacrifice to their gods and you are invited, you eat of his sacrifice,
34.16:
Exo 34:16 and you take of their daughters for your sons, and their daughters whore after their gods and make
your sons whore after their gods.
34.17: Exo 34:17 "You shall not make for yourself any gods of cast metal.
34.18:
Exo 34:18 "You shall keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I
commanded you, at the time appointed in the month Abib, for in the month Abib you came out from Egypt.
34.19: Exo 34:19 All that open the womb are mine, all your male livestock, the firstborn of cow and sheep.
34.20:
Exo 34:20 The firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb, or if you will not redeem it you shall break its
neck. All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem. And none shall appear before me empty-handed.
34.21:
Exo 34:21 "Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest. In plowing time and in harvest you
shall rest.
34.22:
Exo 34:22 You shall observe the Feast of Weeks, the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the Feast of Ingathering at
the year's end.
34.23: Exo 34:23 Three times in the year shall all your males appear before the LORD God, the God of Israel.
34.24:
Exo 34:24 For I will cast out nations before you and enlarge your borders; no one shall covet your land, when
you go up to appear before the LORD your God three times in the year.
34.25:
Exo 34:25 "You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with anything leavened, or let the sacrifice of the Feast
of the Passover remain until the morning.
34.26:
Exo 34:26 The best of the firstfruits of your ground you shall bring to the house of the LORD your God. You
shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk."
34.27:
Exo 34:27 And the LORD said to Moses, "Write these words, for in accordance with these words I have made a
covenant with you and with Israel."
34.28:
Exo 34:28 So he was there with the LORD forty days and forty nights. He neither ate bread nor drank water.
And he wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
34.29:
Exo 34:29 When Moses came down from Mount Sinai, with the two tablets of the testimony in his hand as he
came down from the mountain, Moses did not know that the skin of his face shone because he had been talking
with God.
34.30:
Exo 34:30 Aaron and all the people of Israel saw Moses, and behold, the skin of his face shone, and they were
afraid to come near him.
34.31:
Exo 34:31 But Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the leaders of the congregation returned to him, and
Moses talked with them.
34.32:
Exo 34:32 Afterward all the people of Israel came near, and he commanded them all that the LORD had spoken
with him in Mount Sinai.
34.33: Exo 34:33 And when Moses had finished speaking with them, he put a veil over his face.
34.34:
Exo 34:34 Whenever Moses went in before the LORD to speak with him, he would remove the veil, until he
came out. And when he came out and told the people of Israel what he was commanded,
34.35:
Exo 34:35 the people of Israel would see the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses' face was shining. And
Moses would put the veil over his face again, until he went in to speak with him.

35.1:
Exo 35:1 Moses assembled all the congregation of the people of Israel and said to them, "These are the things
that the LORD has commanded you to do.
35.2:
Exo 35:2 Six days work shall be done, but on the seventh day you shall have a Sabbath of solemn rest, holy to
the LORD. Whoever does any work on it shall be put to death.
35.3: Exo 35:3 You shall kindle no fire in all your dwelling places on the Sabbath day."
35.4:
Exo 35:4 Moses said to all the congregation of the people of Israel, "This is the thing that the LORD has
commanded.
35.5:
Exo 35:5 Take from among you a contribution to the LORD. Whoever is of a generous heart, let him bring the
LORD's contribution: gold, silver, and bronze;
35.6: Exo 35:6 blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen; goats' hair,
35.7: Exo 35:7 tanned rams' skins, and goatskins; acacia wood,
35.8: Exo 35:8 oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
35.9: Exo 35:9 and onyx stones and stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
35.10: Exo 35:10 "Let every skillful craftsman among you come and make all that the LORD has commanded:
35.11: Exo 35:11 the tabernacle, its tent and its covering, its hooks and its frames, its bars, its pillars, and its bases;
35.12: Exo 35:12 the ark with its poles, the mercy seat, and the veil of the screen;
35.13: Exo 35:13 the table with its poles and all its utensils, and the bread of the Presence;
35.14: Exo 35:14 the lampstand also for the light, with its utensils and its lamps, and the oil for the light;
35.15:
Exo 35:15 and the altar of incense, with its poles, and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense, and the screen
for the door, at the door of the tabernacle;
35.16:
Exo 35:16 the altar of burnt offering, with its grating of bronze, its poles, and all its utensils, the basin and its
stand;
35.17: Exo 35:17 the hangings of the court, its pillars and its bases, and the screen for the gate of the court;
35.18: Exo 35:18 the pegs of the tabernacle and the pegs of the court, and their cords;
35.19:
Exo 35:19 the finely worked garments for ministering in the Holy Place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest,
and the garments of his sons, for their service as priests."
35.20: Exo 35:20 Then all the congregation of the people of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
35.21:
Exo 35:21 And they came, everyone whose heart stirred him, and everyone whose spirit moved him, and
brought the LORD's contribution to be used for the tent of meeting, and for all its service, and for the holy
garments.
35.22:
Exo 35:22 So they came, both men and women. All who were of a willing heart brought brooches and earrings
and signet rings and armlets, all sorts of gold objects, every man dedicating an offering of gold to the LORD.
35.23:
Exo 35:23 And every one who possessed blue or purple or scarlet yarns or fine linen or goats' hair or tanned
rams' skins or goatskins brought them.
35.24:
Exo 35:24 Everyone who could make a contribution of silver or bronze brought it as the LORD's contribution.
And every one who possessed acacia wood of any use in the work brought it.
35.25:
Exo 35:25 And every skillful woman spun with her hands, and they all brought what they had spun in blue and
purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen.
35.26: Exo 35:26 All the women whose hearts stirred them to use their skill spun the goats' hair.
35.27: Exo 35:27 And the leaders brought onyx stones and stones to be set, for the ephod and for the breastpiece,
35.28: Exo 35:28 and spices and oil for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense.
35.29:
Exo 35:29 All the men and women, the people of Israel, whose heart moved them to bring anything for the work
that the LORD had commanded by Moses to be done brought it as a freewill offering to the LORD.
35.30:
Exo 35:30 Then Moses said to the people of Israel, "See, the LORD has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri,
son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;
35.31:
Exo 35:31 and he has filled him with the Spirit of God, with skill, with intelligence, with knowledge, and with all
craftsmanship,
35.32: Exo 35:32 to devise artistic designs, to work in gold and silver and bronze,
35.33: Exo 35:33 in cutting stones for setting, and in carving wood, for work in every skilled craft.
35.34: Exo 35:34 And he has inspired him to teach, both him and Oholiab the son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan.
35.35:
Exo 35:35 He has filled them with skill to do every sort of work done by an engraver or by a designer or by an
embroiderer in blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen, or by a weaver- by any sort of workman
or skilled designer.

36.1:
Exo 36:1 "Bezalel and Oholiab and every craftsman in whom the LORD has put skill and intelligence to know
how to do any work in the construction of the sanctuary shall work in accordance with all that the LORD has
commanded."
36.2:
Exo 36:2 And Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab and every craftsman in whose mind the LORD had put skill,
everyone whose heart stirred him up to come to do the work.
36.3:
Exo 36:3 And they received from Moses all the contribution that the people of Israel had brought for doing the
work on the sanctuary. They still kept bringing him freewill offerings every morning,
36.4:
Exo 36:4 so that all the craftsmen who were doing every sort of task on the sanctuary came, each from the task
that he was doing,
36.5:
Exo 36:5 and said to Moses, "The people bring much more than enough for doing the work that the LORD has
commanded us to do."
36.6:
Exo 36:6 So Moses gave command, and word was proclaimed throughout the camp, "Let no man or woman do
anything more for the contribution for the sanctuary." So the people were restrained from bringing,
36.7: Exo 36:7 for the material they had was sufficient to do all the work, and more.
36.8:
Exo 36:8 And all the craftsmen among the workmen made the tabernacle with ten curtains. They were made of
fine twined linen and blue and purple and scarlet yarns, with cherubim skillfully worked.
36.9:
Exo 36:9 The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. All the
curtains were the same size.
36.10: Exo 36:10 He coupled five curtains to one another, and the other five curtains he coupled to one another.
36.11:
Exo 36:11 He made loops of blue on the edge of the outermost curtain of the first set. Likewise he made them
on the edge of the outermost curtain of the second set.
36.12:
Exo 36:12 He made fifty loops on the one curtain, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was in
the second set. The loops were opposite one another.
36.13:
Exo 36:13 And he made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains one to the other with clasps. So the
tabernacle was a single whole.
36.14: Exo 36:14 He also made curtains of goats' hair for a tent over the tabernacle. He made eleven curtains.
36.15:
Exo 36:15 The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. The eleven
curtains were the same size.
36.16: Exo 36:16 He coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
36.17:
Exo 36:17 And he made fifty loops on the edge of the outermost curtain of the one set, and fifty loops on the
edge of the other connecting curtain.
36.18: Exo 36:18 And he made fifty clasps of bronze to couple the tent together that it might be a single whole.
36.19: Exo 36:19 And he made for the tent a covering of tanned rams' skins and goatskins.
36.20: Exo 36:20 Then he made the upright frames for the tabernacle of acacia wood.
36.21: Exo 36:21 Ten cubits was the length of a frame, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each frame.
36.22: Exo 36:22 Each frame had two tenons for fitting together. He did this for all the frames of the tabernacle.
36.23: Exo 36:23 The frames for the tabernacle he made thus: twenty frames for the south side.
36.24:
Exo 36:24 And he made forty bases of silver under the twenty frames, two bases under one frame for its two
tenons, and two bases under the next frame for its two tenons.
36.25: Exo 36:25 For the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty frames
36.26: Exo 36:26 and their forty bases of silver, two bases under one frame and two bases under the next frame.
36.27: Exo 36:27 For the rear of the tabernacle westward he made six frames.
36.28: Exo 36:28 He made two frames for corners of the tabernacle in the rear.
36.29:
Exo 36:29 And they were separate beneath but joined at the top, at the first ring. He made two of them this way
for the two corners.
36.30: Exo 36:30 There were eight frames with their bases of silver: sixteen bases, under every frame two bases.
36.31: Exo 36:31 He made bars of acacia wood, five for the frames of the one side of the tabernacle,
36.32:
Exo 36:32 and five bars for the frames of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the frames of the
tabernacle at the rear westward.
36.33: Exo 36:33 And he made the middle bar to run from end to end halfway up the frames.
36.34:
Exo 36:34 And he overlaid the frames with gold, and made their rings of gold for holders for the bars, and
overlaid the bars with gold.
36.35:
Exo 36:35 He made the veil of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen; with cherubim skillfully
worked into it he made it.
36.36:
Exo 36:36 And for it he made four pillars of acacia and overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were of gold, and
he cast for them four bases of silver.
36.37:
Exo 36:37 He also made a screen for the entrance of the tent, of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine
twined linen, embroidered with needlework,
36.38:
Exo 36:38 and its five pillars with their hooks. He overlaid their capitals, and their fillets were of gold, but their
five bases were of bronze.

37.1:
Exo 37:1 Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood. Two cubits and a half was its length, a cubit and a half its
breadth, and a cubit and a half its height.
37.2: Exo 37:2 And he overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside, and made a molding of gold around it.
37.3:
Exo 37:3 And he cast for it four rings of gold for its four feet, two rings on its one side and two rings on its other
side.
37.4: Exo 37:4 And he made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold
37.5: Exo 37:5 and put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry the ark.
37.6:
Exo 37:6 And he made a mercy seat of pure gold. Two cubits and a half was its length, and a cubit and a half its
breadth.
37.7:
Exo 37:7 And he made two cherubim of gold. He made them of hammered work on the two ends of the mercy
seat,
37.8:
Exo 37:8 one cherub on the one end, and one cherub on the other end. Of one piece with the mercy seat he
made the cherubim on its two ends.
37.9:
Exo 37:9 The cherubim spread out their wings above, overshadowing the mercy seat with their wings, with their
faces one to another; toward the mercy seat were the faces of the cherubim.
37.10:
