Exo 37:10 He also made the table of acacia wood. Two cubits was its length, a cubit its breadth, and a cubit and
a half its height.
37.11: Exo 37:11 And he overlaid it with pure gold, and made a molding of gold around it.
37.12: Exo 37:12 And he made a rim around it a handbreadth wide, and made a molding of gold around the rim.
37.13: Exo 37:13 He cast for it four rings of gold and fastened the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
37.14: Exo 37:14 Close to the frame were the rings, as holders for the poles to carry the table.
37.15: Exo 37:15 He made the poles of acacia wood to carry the table, and overlaid them with gold.
37.16:
Exo 37:16 And he made the vessels of pure gold that were to be on the table, its plates and dishes for incense,
and its bowls and flagons with which to pour drink offerings.
37.17: Exo 37:17 He also made the lampstand of pure gold. He made the lampstand of hammered work. Its base, itsstem, its cups, its calyxes, and its flowers were of one piece with it.
37.18:
Exo 37:18 And there were six branches going out of its sides, three branches of the lampstand out of one side
of it and three branches of the lampstand out of the other side of it;
37.19:
Exo 37:19 three cups made like almond blossoms, each with calyx and flower, on one branch, and three cups
made like almond blossoms, each with calyx and flower, on the other branch- so for the six branches going out
of the lampstand.
37.20:
Exo 37:20 And on the lampstand itself were four cups made like almond blossoms, with their calyxes and
flowers,
37.21: Exo 37:21 and a calyx of one piece with it under each pair of the six branches going out of it.
37.22:
Exo 37:22 Their calyxes and their branches were of one piece with it. The whole of it was a single piece of
hammered work of pure gold.
37.23: Exo 37:23 And he made its seven lamps and its tongs and its trays of pure gold.
37.24: Exo 37:24 He made it and all its utensils out of a talent of pure gold.
37.25:
Exo 37:25 He made the altar of incense of acacia wood. Its length was a cubit, and its breadth was a cubit. It
was square, and two cubits was its height. Its horns were of one piece with it.
37.26:
Exo 37:26 He overlaid it with pure gold, its top and around its sides and its horns. And he made a molding of
gold around it,
37.27:
Exo 37:27 and made two rings of gold on it under its molding, on two opposite sides of it, as holders for the
poles with which to carry it.
37.28: Exo 37:28 And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
37.29: Exo 37:29 He made the holy anointing oil also, and the pure fragrant incense, blended as by the perfumer.

38.1:
Exo 38:1 He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood. Five cubits was its length, and five cubits its
breadth. It was square, and three cubits was its height.
38.2:
Exo 38:2 He made horns for it on its four corners. Its horns were of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with
bronze.
38.3:
Exo 38:3 And he made all the utensils of the altar, the pots, the shovels, the basins, the forks, and the fire pans.
He made all its utensils of bronze.
38.4: Exo 38:4 And he made for the altar a grating, a network of bronze, under its ledge, extending halfway down.
38.5: Exo 38:5 He cast four rings on the four corners of the bronze grating as holders for the poles.
38.6: Exo 38:6 He made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.
38.7:
Exo 38:7 And he put the poles through the rings on the sides of the altar to carry it with them. He made it hollow,
with boards.
38.8:
Exo 38:8 He made the basin of bronze and its stand of bronze, from the mirrors of the ministering women who
ministered in the entrance of the tent of meeting.
38.9:
Exo 38:9 And he made the court. For the south side the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, a
hundred cubits;
38.10:
Exo 38:10 their twenty pillars and their twenty bases were of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their fillets
were of silver.
38.11:
Exo 38:11 And for the north side there were hangings of a hundred cubits, their twenty pillars, their twenty
bases were of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
38.12:
Exo 38:12 And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their ten pillars, and their ten bases; the hooks of
the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
38.13: Exo 38:13 And for the front to the east, fifty cubits.
38.14: Exo 38:14 The hangings for one side of the gate were fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and three bases.
38.15:
Exo 38:15 And so for the other side. On both sides of the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits, with
their three pillars and their three bases.
38.16: Exo 38:16 All the hangings around the court were of fine twined linen.
38.17:
Exo 38:17 And the bases for the pillars were of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
The overlaying of their capitals was also of silver, and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.
38.18:
Exo 38:18 And the screen for the gate of the court was embroidered with needlework in blue and purple and
scarlet yarns and fine twined linen. It was twenty cubits long and five cubits high in its breadth, corresponding to
the hangings of the court.
38.19:
Exo 38:19 And their pillars were four in number. Their four bases were of bronze, their hooks of silver, and the
overlaying of their capitals and their fillets of silver.
38.20: Exo 38:20 And all the pegs for the tabernacle and for the court all around were of bronze.
38.21:
Exo 38:21 These are the records of the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the testimony, as they were recorded at
the commandment of Moses, the responsibility of the Levites under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the
priest.
38.22: Exo 38:22 Bezalel the son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the LORD commanded Moses;
38.23:
Exo 38:23 and with him was Oholiab the son of Ahis-amach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver and designer and
embroiderer in blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine twined linen.
38.24:
Exo 38:24 All the gold that was used for the work, in all the construction of the sanctuary, the gold from the
offering, was twenty-nine talents and 730 shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary.
38.25:
Exo 38:25 The silver from those of the congregation who were recorded was a hundred talents and 1,775
shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary:
38.26:
Exo 38:26 a beka a head (that is, half a shekel, by the shekel of the sanctuary), for everyone who was listed in
the records, from twenty years old and upward, for 603,550 men.
38.27:
Exo 38:27 The hundred talents of silver were for casting the bases of the sanctuary and the bases of the veil; a
hundred bases for the hundred talents, a talent a base.
38.28:
Exo 38:28 And of the 1,775 shekels he made hooks for the pillars and overlaid their capitals and made fillets for
them.
38.29: Exo 38:29 The bronze that was offered was seventy talents and 2,400 shekels;
38.30:
Exo 38:30 with it he made the bases for the entrance of the tent of meeting, the bronze altar and the bronze
grating for it and all the utensils of the altar,
38.31:
Exo 38:31 the bases around the court, and the bases of the gate of the court, all the pegs of the tabernacle, and
all the pegs around the court.

39.1:
Exo 39:1 From the blue and purple and scarlet yarns they made finely woven garments, for ministering in the
Holy Place. They made the holy garments for Aaron, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
39.2: Exo 39:2 He made the ephod of gold, blue and purple and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen.
39.3:
Exo 39:3 And they hammered out gold leaf, and he cut it into threads to work into the blue and purple and the
scarlet yarns, and into the fine twined linen, in skilled design.
39.4: Exo 39:4 They made for the ephod attaching shoulder pieces, joined to it at its two edges.
39.5:
Exo 39:5 And the skillfully woven band on it was of one piece with it and made like it, of gold, blue and purple
and scarlet yarns, and fine twined linen, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
39.6:
Exo 39:6 They made the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold filigree, and engraved like the engravings of a
signet, according to the names of the sons of Israel.
39.7:
Exo 39:7 And he set them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod to be stones of remembrance for the sons of
Israel, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
39.8:
Exo 39:8 He made the breastpiece, in skilled work, in the style of the ephod, of gold, blue and purple and scarlet
yarns, and fine twined linen.
39.9:
Exo 39:9 It was square. They made the breastpiece doubled, a span its length and a span its breadth when
doubled.
39.10: Exo 39:10 And they set in it four rows of stones. A row of sardius, topaz, and carbuncle was the first row;
39.11: Exo 39:11 and the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond;
39.12: Exo 39:12 and the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
39.13: Exo 39:13 and the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. They were enclosed in settings of gold filigree.
39.14:
Exo 39:14 There were twelve stones with their names according to the names of the sons of Israel. They were
like signets, each engraved with its name, for the twelve tribes.
39.15: Exo 39:15 And they made on the breastpiece twisted chains like cords, of pure gold.
39.16:
Exo 39:16 And they made two settings of gold filigree and two gold rings, and put the two rings on the two
edges of the breastpiece.
39.17: Exo 39:17 And they put the two cords of gold in the two rings at the edges of the breastpiece.
39.18:
Exo 39:18 They attached the two ends of the two cords to the two settings of filigree. Thus they attached it in
front to the shoulder pieces of the ephod.
39.19:
Exo 39:19 Then they made two rings of gold, and put them at the two ends of the breastpiece, on its inside edge
next to the ephod.
39.20:
Exo 39:20 And they made two rings of gold, and attached them in front to the lower part of the two shoulder
pieces of the ephod, at its seam above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
39.21:
Exo 39:21 And they bound the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, so that it
should lie on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastpiece should not come loose from the
ephod, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
39.22: Exo 39:22 He also made the robe of the ephod woven all of blue,
39.23:
Exo 39:23 and the opening of the robe in it was like the opening in a garment, with a binding around the
opening, so that it might not tear.
39.24:
Exo 39:24 On the hem of the robe they made pomegranates of blue and purple and scarlet yarns and fine
twined linen.
39.25:
Exo 39:25 They also made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates all around the hem
of the robe, between the pomegranates
39.26:
Exo 39:26 a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate around the hem of the robe for ministering, as
the LORD had commanded Moses.
39.27: Exo 39:27 They also made the coats, woven of fine linen, for Aaron and his sons,
39.28:
Exo 39:28 and the turban of fine linen, and the caps of fine linen, and the linen undergarments of fine twined
linen,
39.29:
Exo 39:29 and the sash of fine twined linen and of blue and purple and scarlet yarns, embroidered with
needlework, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
39.30:
Exo 39:30 They made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote on it an inscription, like the engraving
of a signet, "Holy to the LORD."
39.31:
Exo 39:31 And they tied to it a cord of blue to fasten it on the turban above, as the LORD had commanded
Moses.
39.32:
Exo 39:32 Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting was finished, and the people of Israel did
according to all that the LORD had commanded Moses; so they did.
39.33:
Exo 39:33 Then they brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent and all its utensils, its hooks, its frames, its bars,
its pillars, and its bases;
39.34: Exo 39:34 the covering of tanned rams' skins and goatskins, and the veil of the screen;
39.35: Exo 39:35 the ark of the testimony with its poles and the mercy seat;
39.36: Exo 39:36 the table with all its utensils, and the bread of the Presence;
39.37:
Exo 39:37 the lampstand of pure gold and its lamps with the lamps set and all its utensils, and the oil for the
light;
39.38:
Exo 39:38 the golden altar, the anointing oil and the fragrant incense, and the screen for the entrance of the
tent;
39.39: Exo 39:39 the bronze altar, and its grating of bronze, its poles, and all its utensils; the basin and its stand;
39.40:
Exo 39:40 the hangings of the court, its pillars, and its bases, and the screen for the gate of the court, its cords,
and its pegs; and all the utensils for the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of meeting;
39.41:
Exo 39:41 the finely worked garments for ministering in the Holy Place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest,
and the garments of his sons for their service as priests.
39.42:
Exo 39:42 According to all that the LORD had commanded Moses, so the people of Israel had done all the
work.
39.43:
Exo 39:43 And Moses saw all the work, and behold, they had done it; as the LORD had commanded, so had
they done it. Then Moses blessed them.

40.1: Exo 40:1 The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
40.2: Exo 40:2 "On the first day of the first month you shall erect the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
40.3: Exo 40:3 And you shall put in it the ark of the testimony, and you shall screen the ark with the veil.
40.4:
Exo 40:4 And you shall bring in the table and arrange it, and you shall bring in the lampstand and set up its
lamps.
40.5:
Exo 40:5 And you shall put the golden altar for incense before the ark of the testimony, and set up the screen
for the door of the tabernacle.
40.6: Exo 40:6 You shall set the altar of burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting,
40.7: Exo 40:7 and place the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water in it.
40.8: Exo 40:8 And you shall set up the court all around, and hang up the screen for the gate of the court.
40.9:
Exo 40:9 "Then you shall take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it, and consecrate it
and all its furniture, so that it may become holy.
40.10:
Exo 40:10 You shall also anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and consecrate the altar, so that
the altar may become most holy.
40.11: Exo 40:11 You shall also anoint the basin and its stand, and consecrate it.
40.12:
Exo 40:12 Then you shall bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and shall wash them
with water
40.13:
Exo 40:13 and put on Aaron the holy garments. And you shall anoint him and consecrate him, that he may
serve me as priest.
40.14: Exo 40:14 You shall bring his sons also and put coats on them,
40.15:
Exo 40:15 and anoint them, as you anointed their father, that they may serve me as priests. And their anointing
shall admit them to a perpetual priesthood throughout their generations."
40.16: Exo 40:16 This Moses did; according to all that the LORD commanded him, so he did.
40.17: Exo 40:17 In the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, the tabernacle was erected.
40.18:
Exo 40:18 Moses erected the tabernacle. He laid its bases, and set up its frames, and put in its poles, and
raised up its pillars.
40.19:
Exo 40:19 And he spread the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering of the tent over it, as the LORD had
commanded Moses.
40.20:
Exo 40:20 He took the testimony and put it into the ark, and put the poles on the ark and set the mercy seat
above on the ark.
40.21:
Exo 40:21 And he brought the ark into the tabernacle and set up the veil of the screen, and screened the ark of
the testimony, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
40.22: Exo 40:22 He put the table in the tent of meeting, on the north side of the tabernacle, outside the veil,
40.23: Exo 40:23 and arranged the bread on it before the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
40.24: Exo 40:24 He put the lampstand in the tent of meeting, opposite the table on the south side of the tabernacle,
40.25: Exo 40:25 and set up the lamps before the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
40.26: Exo 40:26 He put the golden altar in the tent of meeting before the veil,
40.27: Exo 40:27 and burned fragrant incense on it, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
40.28: Exo 40:28 He put in place the screen for the door of the tabernacle.
40.29:
Exo 40:29 And he set the altar of burnt offering at the entrance of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting, and
offered on it the burnt offering and the grain offering, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
40.30: Exo 40:30 He set the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water in it for washing,
40.31: Exo 40:31 with which Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet.
40.32:
Exo 40:32 When they went into the tent of meeting, and when they approached the altar, they washed, as the
LORD commanded Moses.
40.33:
Exo 40:33 And he erected the court around the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the screen of the gate of the
court. So Moses finished the work.
40.34: Exo 40:34 Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
40.35:
Exo 40:35 And Moses was not able to enter the tent of meeting because the cloud settled on it, and the glory of
the LORD filled the tabernacle.
40.36:
Exo 40:36 Throughout all their journeys, whenever the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the people
of Israel would set out.
40.37: Exo 40:37 But if the cloud was not taken up, then they did not set out till the day that it was taken up.
40.38:
Exo 40:38 For the cloud of the LORD was on the tabernacle by day, and fire was in it by night, in the sight of all
the house of Israel throughout all their journey
